title: Call of Juarez: The Cartel
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Some distinguishing features give this shooter a touch of class but bugs and execution flaws cast a long shadow over Call of Juarez: The Cartel.

title: Dead Horde
review: Dead Horde is dead awful. [Sept 2011]

title: Mr. Driller Online
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Puzzle | General
review: Sugary sweet and addictive puzzle fun. [May 2008 p.93]

title: Infinity Runner
review: The motion controls aren’t the best and I wouldn’t recommend using them while the stuttering on the loading screens also needs addressing. If you’re looking for a small game to play though and like first person runners then Infinity Runner could well be for you.

title: Grooverider Slot Car Thunder
review: Everything about it screams budget sure but there are much worse full-priced games on the Xbox. [Oct/Nov 2003 p.99]

title: Generation Zero
review: The gameplay loop of loot shoot and run all feels good and I’d like to see more story added to the game. Also it would be great if there were more machines more weapons and proper difficulty scaling for players who want to play by themselves. Above all the world is just too big.

title: Hard Truck: Apocalypse
genres: Simulation | Driving | Car Combat | Car Combat | Vehicle | Combat
review: Given the decidely mixed gameplay you have to have a certain love of kitsch to get far in Hard Truck Apocalypse. [Oct. 2006 p.68]

title: Hard Rock Casino
review: For $20 you get a variety of games that is far beyond anything else that I’ve played on the PS2. The game plays well if you don’t feel like you have to have a deep and detailed story mode.

title: Hyperdimension Neptunia
review: This game is for gamers who love jrpg manga anime moe and those kinds of entertainment. The main concept is funny enough to catch the players interest and the gameplay is quite good. Unfortunatly the graphs engine is old and clumsy.

title: Bravo Team
review: Bravo Team is a good game that manages to recreate the feeling of collaborative shooters from the old days.

title: Rodea the Sky Soldier
review: There’s moments of fun to be found here but I think I’d be better suited trying my luck on the consoles – at least there I can expect a solid framerate and finer camera control. But the search for a quality 3DS character action game will have to continue for now.

title: Smart Bomb
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Puzzle | General
review: Had potential but its ultimately too unpolished and player unfriendly for any but the most puzzle hardcore. [July 2005 p.88]

title: Catwoman
review: The elements were in place for a solid platforming title with a little hand-to-hand combat thrown in for good measure. Unfortunately a painfully annoying camera and some downright boring combat kept that from coming to fruition.

title: Earthworm Jim 2
review: With better action games out there for GBA I suggest leaving this earthworm to the fisherman. [Sept 2002 p.94]

title: Shadow the Hedgehog
review: The magic of the 2D versions have all but been lost in a search for technical accomplishment and it suffers terribly for it.

title: Crash: Mind Over Mutant
review: I will have to say that Crash: Mind Over Mutant is a very fun and innovative game that is easy to get into and play.

title: Battlestar Galactica
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: This game is an unchallenging space shooter made a little more difficult with frustrating design and a terrible camera angle. Even if you’re a fan of the TV series we really cannot recommend a purchase.

title: Rodea the Sky Soldier
review: The new project from Sonic’s father Yuji Naka brings an adventure on sky pretty difficult to control with beautiful but simple landscapes and an amazing story. Sadly we expected more from the little robot Rodea.

title: Warriors: Legends of Troy
review: Warriors: Legends of Troy is a pretty impressive project from Tecmo-Koei Canada. It features an interesting storyline that provides a great backdrop for a video game as well as some well-done cutscenes and audio. However its repetitive gameplay is something that will turn a lot of people off even if it is more polished than its ever been.

title: Ford Bold Moves Street Racing
review: I came into it expecting something terrible given the reputation of past Ford games but I ended up with an above average game that didnt really screw anything up and actually featured innovation - so Im quite pleased with it.

title: Darkest of Days
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: If Darkest of Days were a film it would make the rounds at festivals where flawed but interesting has its place. But there are no festivals in gaming outside of the ten games that get selected for spotlight every year at PAX.

title: The Scourge Project: Episodes 1 and 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Far from being a masterpiece The Scourge Project: Episodes 1 and 2 for a budget price offers a single player campaign that lasts about five hours an interesting co-op mode for four players and a series of classic multiplayer competitive modes.

title: Sword of the Stars II: Lords of Winter
review: But if youre a person who doesnt want to wait around for patches and who likes a gaming experience you can glide into rather than struggle through I sadly suggest either giving this one a pass or at least giving it time to get patched up in time for a steep Steam sale.

title: Zoo Tycoon DS
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: About as much fun as giving an elephant a suppository. [Jan 2006 p.157]

title: Watchmen: The End Is Nigh Part 2
review: Just like the first entry this one doesnt try to escape from the simple button mashing combo street brawler.

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutants in Manhattan
review: Fighting moving and pulling off cooperative attacks as the Turtles is enjoyable but it’s difficult to find fun in the world and routine in which they exist.

title: Dinotopia: The Sunstone Odyssey
review: For younger gamers it tries to offer some valuable lessons about respect for others and responsibility but the message seems to be clouded by all the pointless side missions and mindless monologues of other characters.

title: Superman: The Man of Steel
review: The gameplay however suffers from severe redundancy. [Jan 2003 p.83]

title: ESPN National Hockey Night
review: The framerate is horrendously bad at times. Theres no logical reason why a game representing a sport with nearly as many TOTAL players as other sports have per TEAM should suffer framerate hits.

title: Watchmen: The End Is Nigh Part 2
review: As a Watchmen fan it was impossible for me to not enjoy this game. For anyone else however there just isn’t enough substance to warrant the ridiculously overpriced cost.

title: Hummer Badlands
review: The drive anywhere at anytime mentality that seems to be the driving force just wasnt executed well enough so instead the game remains a generic racer with a Hummer coating.

title: TMNT: Mutant Melee
review: Repetitious button-mashing gameplay that rarely engages the brain is the undertone of this title.

title: Last Rebellion
genres: Role-Playing | Action RPG | Console-style RPG | Console-style RPG | Japanese-Style
review: Last Rebellion is a game that will likely become a niche title down the road and for good reason. The combat system is definitely something special. If only everything else had come together this game could have easily been a must-own.

title: Chronovolt
review: Buggy and unpolished Chronovolt isnt worth your time no matter how many times your turn the clock back.

title: Dead Island: Ryder White
review: Ryder White is a good DLC. It is essential to understand background and mentality of the greatest enemy in Dead Island. If you loved the full game dont miss it.

title: The Mummy Returns
review: The actual gameplay is unlikely to impress serious gamers and may to some the game may be found seriously wanting.

title: State of Emergency 2
review: Playing through State of Emergency 2 is a lot like watching a decent actor try to produce a real performance in a straight-to-video horror movie. [Apr 2006 p.122]

title: AeternoBlade II
review: AeternoBlade II had the potential to be a notable metroidvania in the Nintendo Switch’s library but unfortunately it will be remembered as little more than a bug-laden mess regardless of the couple of interesting ideas it brought forward.

title: Fimbul
review: Fimbul creates an appealingly grim Norse folklore-infused world to adventure through but its core action is simply too weak to seal the deal. Its pacy combat can be brutally satisfying but its also shallow and repetitive while the game struggles from a technical perspective. Theres a promising world at the heart of Fimbul but it needs to be married to a more fluid and fleshed-out game.

title: Golden Axe: Beast Rider
review: Golden Axe: Beast Rider confuses the tribute to retro with the flat and boring gameplay. The new game of SEGA is mediocre in every aspect and comes as a failure in its attempt to recover a legendary name and turn it into a worthy product of Next-Gen platforms.

title: MotoGP 08
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | Motorcycle | Automobile | Street | Street
review: MotoGP 08 delivers a sub-par experience in every single aspect: graphics are shallow controls are dull and unresponsive and the gameplay is kinda boring. Still its one of the few serious racing games on Wii but thats hardly gonna be a selling point.

title: Hard Rock Casino
review: Hard Rock Casino shouldnt be a terrible game but it is.

title: Bubsy: The Woolies Strike Back
review: Bubsy: The Woolies Strike Back underwhelms and disappoints at every turn. Bland level design never improves and tedious boss battles are unrewarding and unsatisfying. Bubsys return 21 years later could have reminded us why he was once considered a potential peer to the likes of Mario and Sonic. Instead The Woolies Strike Back only serves to remind us why the mascot hasnt seen a new adventure in over two decades.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: A mere add-on to the previous game short and without any improvements to the first game even losing features like Kinect support.

title: Swashbucklers: Blue vs. Grey
review: Swashbucklers doesn’t have anything that’s worth the purchase and it can be looked over by most gamers.

title: Discs of Tron
review: Discs of Tron does hold quite a bit of enjoyment especially of the latter stages. [Issue#31 p.117]

title: Splat Renegade Paintball
review: Though Splat Magazine Renegade Paintball has some serious problems it delivers an authentic paintball experience rife with intense adrenaline-pumping action that is sure to please fans of the sport and possibly snag some new ones in the process.

title: Big Mutha Truckers 2
genres: Driving | Racing | Mission-based | Arcade | Mission-based | Automobile
review: If humorous driving jaunts are your bag do yourself a favour and bag San Andreas instead.

title: Warriors Orochi 2
review: Its the same game youve been playing a long time ago. At least Koei fanatics might be satisfied with the formula.

title: Big Beach Sports
review: As it is Big Beach Sports will provide some fairly limited short term fun but when available for less than £20 maybe thats not such a bad thing.

title: The Sacred Rings
review: I can’t think of another game where the developers apparently tried so hard to make it no fun to play. As a result The Sacred Rings is just a bad game. The puzzles are tedious the locations are dark and the premise is silly (you actually spend more time trying to reunite two dead lovers than you do dealing with the Sacred Rings).

title: Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark
review: Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark main problems are that High Moon Studios didnt developed it and that the terrible Michael Bays movie Transformers: Age of Extinction was merged with the marvelous universe of War for Cybertron and Fall of Cybertron.

title: Tetris Worlds
review: At a tenner this would have been okay but for a penny under £20 this just can’t be recommended.

title: NFL QB Club 2001
review: The fact is both NFL2K and NFL2K blow this game away on literally every level.

title: Q*bert: Rebooted
review: Its a quaint little curio for fans of arcade games then but its not exactly a must have.

title: Risen 3: Titan Lords
review: The biggest issue is not that the development set their sights incredibly high but simply that this kind of game is a mammoth project and there is simply no way that a limited budget can pull off something of the standard of say Skyrim. Risen 3 is a raw entertaining experience that lacks polish but offers substance.

title: Army Men: Sarge's War
review: It looks nice it plays nicely and its short BUT it is a budget title and at £20 it is a steal.

title: Pac-Man World 3
review: Every platforming challenge is camera related. Its sad because there is a lot of untapped potential in Pac-Man World 3.

title: Combat of Giants: Dinosaurs 3D
review: Overall this is the nicest cleanest 3D game I have yet to see on the 3DS. I cant wait to see more titles from Ubisoft as it appears that they have utilized the 3D screen to its fullest. Unfortunately for its lack of gameplay variety and the simplistic controls I do not recommend it for more mature gamers.

title: Husk
review: One could also make the argument that if a game’s story is poor the gameplay can at least make up for it and vice versa. Husk manages come frustratingly close at times leaving the game undone by its inconsistency.

title: Naughty Bear: Panic in Paradise
review: Naughty Bear: Panic in Paradise is a much better effort than its predecessor. By adding in the costumes system 505 Games have managed to give the game a layer of depth previously missing. However whilst repetition doesnt entirely spoil the party it certainly takes the shine off after a while.

title: Johnny Kung Fu
review: In the end I was left with the feeling that Johnny Kung Fu was sold short of its true potential. The basic premise is good the gameplay (well half of the gameplay…) is spot on but sadly the game is hindered by an unnecessarily brutal spike in difficulty and a repetitive unrewarding design that makes a game that was once unique and challenging turn into to a bore of a reaction-time test.

title: FunTown Mahjong
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | Puzzle | Matching | Board / Card Game | Matching
review: Funtown Mahjong is a simplified version of the more complex Chinese board game mahjong. The main issue plaguing this title is the fact that its not simple enough to attract the uninitiated while not being challenging enough for the veterans. The game could very well have utilized the possibilities that a console game offers to the gameplay mechanics but since this isnt the case youll be better of taking a closer look at the real deal.

title: Crash Time: Autobahn Pursuit
review: Unlocking different vehicles and tracks for the multiplayer provides some incentive to push onward but theres not much past that.

title: Godzilla: Unleashed
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Sci-Fi | Fighting | General | 3D
review: Sadly enough these great features cannot save you from a horrendous storyline generic sounds and iffy controls.

title: Beowulf: The Game
review: In this day and age it shouldn’t come as a surprise that a game based on a movie fares poorly but for a character who has survived since 700AD he deserves better treatment than this.

title: NeverEnd (2006)
genres: Role-Playing | Console-style RPG | Console-style RPG | Japanese-Style
review: The graphics hold the game back as most PC RPGs are better looking.

title: Jonny Moseley Mad Trix
review: The visuals and sounds keep up with the pace although you may be too busy with the controller to notice.

title: Street Trace: NYC
genres: Simulation | Driving | Car Combat | Car Combat | Vehicle | Combat
review: Unfortunately for Street Trace there are just far too many better games coming down the road for it to be able to maintain the multiplayer community it will need to succeed.

title: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Advanced Warfighter
review: There comes a time when you should just move on. I think Tom Clancy games and the Playstation 2 should go ahead and part ways. The system just isnt powerful enough to do what I think UbiSoft really wants to do with their games.

title: Harmonix Music VR
review: If Harmonix Music VR sounds like your jam it probably is. Plopping on the helmet after eating your favorite comfort food can make for a really relaxing afternoon but the other modes arent even worth the time of day.

title: Cops 2170: The Power of Law
review: The dated graphics repetitive sounds and high difficulty make this game more frustrating than it has to be.

title: C.O.R.E.
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: You could definitely pass up C.O.R.E. and while I like the idea of someone at least trying to put out a genre title that doesnt typically get made on the NDS I also feel that C.O.R.E. is an example of why FPSes dont make the transition well to the DS.

title: Oddworld: Munch's Oddysee
review: If any more Oddworld games are brought to the GBA I really hope that they go back to the side-scrolling format. In fact a direct port of the original Oddworld for Playstaion wouldnt be a bad idea and would have surely come out better than this game did.

title: Dragonriders: Chronicles of Pern
review: An absolute must for fans of the series - its as engrossing and complex as the best of Anne McCaffreys novels and as a stand-alone story its fun and well worth it.

title: Iron Man
review: Visually disappointing lacking in challenge and generally not that much fun Iron Man singularly fails to communicate the excitement found in its big screen counterpart.

title: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Falsebound Kingdom
review: Even with relatively few RPGs on the GameCube Falsebound Kingdoms relatively simple approach isnt that captivating - unless youre a Yu-Gi-Oh fan who is a newbie to the RPG genre. [Jan 2004 p.141]

title: Mike Tyson Boxing
review: The fighting is slow and boring with even slower controls the graphics aren’t much and the sound is just average.

title: Mike Tyson Boxing
review: If youre a fan of the child-eating boxer help yourself to a serving of Mike Tyson Boxing. Otherwise spend your bet money on Knockout Kings or Ready 2 Rumble 2.

title: TotemBall
review: Sadly the games not much fun - you get bored easily and theres not much variety to be had waving your arms up and down. [Dec 2006 p.99]

title: Hellboy: The Science of Evil
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Beat-'Em-Up | Beat-'Em-Up | Linear
review: When all is said and done Hellboy: The Science of Evil might have been a hit during the last generation of consoles. On the current consoles though it just falls short in nearly every regard.

title: Vaccine
review: A game which seems to draw a lot from Resident Evil Vaccine is more than just a clone; its a hard-as-nails rendition of what the series would be like if it was procedurally generated and smaller in scope. At this theyve succeeded and have managed to weave in some fun to boot. Its not the best Resident Evil clone Ive ever played but its better than average - and the gameplay twists are both addictive and satisfying in their own right.

title: Cortex Command
genres: Action | Strategy | Real-Time | Platformer | Platformer | 2D | 2D | Command
review: Cortex Command is brilliant but unfortunately still incomplete. The strong community is trying to fix the many problems the games has but as of now it still not enough. For almost twenty euros we can recommend the game only to the most patient gamers.

title: NPPL Championship Paintball 2009
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: It’s easy to see how paintball enthusiasts could love this game but hard to envision anybody else spending more than an hour playing it before they got bored and disillusioned.

title: Iron Man
review: Overall the Iron Man title on the Wii lacked the spark that the film had; however it’s a huge step up from last years A2M film franchise adaptation known as The Golden Compass. That said if players are looking for a film to game adaptation that actually reflects the film they should look elsewhere.

title: Black Stone: Magic & Steel
review: BS is no gem mind you but it is strangely addicting as these games tend to be when the mood strikes. [June 2003 p.57]

title: Ridge Racer
review: Disturbing lack of content impedes the score but what is here is streamlined speedy fun. [March 2012 p.75]

title: Battleship
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Shooter | Board Games | Shooter | Board Games | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Tactical
review: This is not going to set the gaming world on fire by any means but if youre a sucker for movie tie-ins have reasonable to low FPS expectations and dont mind some light RTS antics Battleship is a decent enough distraction for a handful of hours or so.

title: SunAge
review: The main problem of SunAge is that without the patches released the game is a disaster.

title: Submersed
review: Submersed is a survival horror game with good ideas drowned by a short duration bad enemy and level design weak gameplay and a narrative that feels underdeveloped.

title: Mindjack
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Modern | Arcade
review: A great concept brimming with unexplored potential anchored by dull shooter mechanics.

title: Infinity Runner
review: As endless runners go Infinity Runner is a fine example but greatly lacks polish and finesse.

title: Tony Hawk Ride
genres: Sports | Alternative | Individual | Skateboarding | Skateboarding | Skate / Skateboard
review: The huge level of frustration is not worth the time it takes to master the awkward gameplay idiosyncrasies. Instead it’s more tempting – even as someone with experience – to just spam the waggle movements for a passable high score.

title: Combat: Task Force 121
review: While the online play is merely average at best its single-player play as well as its overall production values present themselves as seriously subpar.

title: Empire of Magic
review: Some of the individual aspects of the game need to be reworked simply because they seem forced. The game strives to attain a lofty place but comes up a little short.

title: Evolution Skateboarding
review: Sluggish at best and the controls leave a lot to be desired. Very often this game looks like it is moving at half speed and you never get that visual feeling of speed that you get from other titles.

title: Salt Lake 2002
genres: Sports | Olympic Sports | Olympic Sports | Individual | Athletics
review: Despite a slick presentation and several clearly enjoyable moments Salt Lake fails to capture the magnitude of this periodic winter spectacle and is in reality an entertaining yet brief whirl through just a fraction of the events you might expect.

title: Calvino Noir
review: Calvino Noir starts off strong with a great setting and cast of characters but finds itself almost totally crippled on account of its heavily flawed stealth mechanics; a tragically missed opportunity.

title: Tornado
review: A strict time limit also detracts from whats otherwise a fun game. [Nov 2008 p.104]

title: Gothic 3: Forsaken Gods
genres: Role-Playing | PC-style RPG | PC-style RPG | Western-Style
review: A downright frightening army of bugs both scares away any potential fan of Gothic and eliminates any fun that could have been had with the game. [Issue#17]

title: MilitAnt
review: Quotation forthcoming.

title: Pirates vs Ninjas Dodgeball
review: If however youre after something inoffensive to entertain the youngsters without having to explain about death the birds and the bees or any other adult themes you could do worse.

title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Wrath of the Darkhul King
review: Has its shining moments of fun but these precious moments are overshadowed by a far greater evil--terrible level design and slow-as-molasses controls.

title: Metal Dungeon
review: Its fundamentals are solid enough but too bland and redundant. [Jan 2003 p.78]

title: Jurassic Park III: The DNA Factor
review: The problem is much of it is done so darned sloppily.

title: Bombshell (2016)
review: Bombshell is an old school action game. It is fun and has a couple of good ideas but it has a lot of mistakes too. A boring interface a wrong camera.

title: Enemy Front
genres: Shooter | Historic | Action | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Historic
review: Though it can pack a punch this lacks the finesse to tell the subversive war story its aiming for. [Sept 2014 p.74]

title: Terminator Salvation
review: Terminator: Salvation is a run-of-the-mill game adaption of a successful movie brand. Overall okay but way too short and without any highlights or variety.

title: Turning Point: Fall of Liberty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: And while it’s a solid enough shooter that’ll largely cure the itch for frag-heads it just fails to do anything to particularly excite.

title: Star Trek The Video Game
review: Star Trek does a good job in terms of script and atmosphere and its decent on long-distance gunplay. But the overall experience is poor and unpolished.

title: Danger Girl
review: Its fun enough but its definitely not dangerous.

title: Word Puzzle
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Logic | General
review: A game that’s probably better left to pen and paper. The game offers solid variety and decent puzzle design but at the end of the day you’re still doing with a controller that which is much easier and just as rewarding with a pencil.

title: Devil's Third
genres: Action Adventure | General | Modern | Action | Shooter | Third-Person | Arcade
review: The best thing we can say about its campaign is that it works as a tutorial. The multiplayer mode is the key of this title but you need to understand how it really works to make the most of it.

title: Everreach: Project Eden
review: In the case of Everreach: Project Eden some mechanical issues with AI or balance can be patched which other problems are more in the realm of aesthetics and direction and are probably doomed to never go away. There’s nothing wrong with a game having a clear inspiration — most every game does — but failing to innovate on that model can result in what we have here a product that feels like an unconvincing imitation.

title: Blood Knights
genres: Role-Playing | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy | Action RPG
review: Blood Knights is too easy to ever become actively irritating but its deficit of danger makes it too darn dull to hold even a devoted horror nut’s attention for long. Perhaps it’s a blessing then that the whole ho-hum campaign clocks in at just four hours.

title: Digimon World Data Squad
review: All in all there’s very little reason to get Digimon World: Data Squad. Between the simplistic-yet-frustrating battle system and the absolutely terrible graphics there just isn’t anything positive to say about the game.

title: Six Flags Fun Park
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | General | Party | Party / Minigame
review: Just do yourself a favor skip this game and go have fun with the real thing.

title: Monster Jam
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | Truck | Truck | Automobile
review: Upon first sight and play this game can be judged quite easily as a bog standard mediocre racing frenzy game any excuse for a bit of chaos.

title: Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime
genres: Action Adventure | Modern | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | General
review: Even if you are a Ghostbusters fan Sanctum of Slime is still difficult to recommend – it hardly contains any fanservice at all. [May 2011 p.81]

title: Power Rangers Super Megaforce
review: Its a manufactured experience thats still more superficial than engrossing but its a step in the right direction.

title: Quantum Theory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: If you like epic storytelling skip this one. The KI is lame and doesnt motivate you at all but the multiplayer is fun for a few hours.

title: John Deere: Harvest in the Heartland
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Only a select few will be hooked for more than a few seasons. John Deere Harvest in the Heartland is extremely addictive but also extremely frustrating – not because the game is challenging or cheap but because of the inexcusable issues that prevent it from reaching its full potential.

title: New Rally-X
review: Overall it makes for a slightly better game than Pac-Man and Ms Pac-Man though thats not saying much. [Feb 2007 p.101]

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: A more experienced studio could have made lemonade from these licensed lemons and turn the final chapter into a good action shooter. Unfortunately the team at EA Bright Light had neither time nor experience.

title: FIFA 20: Legacy Edition
review: Putting it simply there is still fun to be had with FIFA 20 Legacy Edition and playing against others online is still a joy. Nevertheless charging full whack for a game when absolutely no effort went into is out of order. Simply ask yourself this are new kits and some roster changes worth over £40 to you? If you answered yes then you have too much money.

title: Soldner: Secret Wars
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Tactical | Modern
review: Youll have to deal with a clunky interface and menu silly single-player missions brain-dead A.I. bizarre vehicle physics horrible net code dull graphics and sound and more bugs than a Georgia swamp in June.

title: Spuds Unearthed
review: Spuds Unearthed has a lot of cool elements but they unfortunately don’t add up to a very compelling game. Plagued by overly complex interface elements and a very flimsy structure the core gameplay just isn’t interesting enough to keep players coming back for more.

title: Hatred
genres: Modern | Action | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Arcade | Top-Down
review: Hatred is a very playable game for fans of adrenaline and bloody thrills although the content of the game is a bit controversial. The game could be longer more diverse and better optimized (Unreal Engine 4 is hungry for power). And given the overall quality Hatred did not deserve all the media buzz surrounding its development and most likely it wont be remembered in a few years time.

title: Flushed Away
review: Flushed Away isnt a terrible game but it does nothing to encourage me to go and see the film again and tarnishes what is easily one of the funniest films of the year.

title: New Gundam Breaker
review: A clear step backwards compared to its predecessor.

title: PDC World Championship Darts 2008
review: The gameplay works but the simple presentation and general lack of polish unfortunately relegate the game to something only a very small minority will enjoy.

title: PlayStation Move Ape Escape
review: A disappointing game that although succeeds in being a game for all types of public is too repetitive and has a very limited cooperative gameplay.

title: 1950s Lawn Mower Kids
review: So dont bother volunteering for any extra chores around the house to earn money for this one. You might have more fun just actually mowing the yard.

title: Final Fight: Streetwise
review: Unfortunately the end result is a little more Rambo a lot less Rocky. Its going to take a rethinking to pull the 3D brawler out of its me too phase and Streetwise certainly isnt helping.

title: Zathura
review: Zathura isnt a particularly bad title; it just lacks anything that puts it above most other recent releases.

title: The Elder Scrolls: Blades
review: The most interesting feature is in fact the cross save that allows you to play indifferently on Switch or mobile devices.

title: Pac-Man Party 3D
review: If youre thirsting for some Pac-Man partying Id go out and find the Wii version as its more accessible and for petes sake the game was clearly designed for the Wii.

title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
genres: Action | General | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Arcade
review: Slow-witted camera idiotic targeting system and abysmal vehicle sections. [Oct 2009 p.82]

title: Sonic the Hedgehog
review: Some good ideas and lush graphics marred by bad game design. [Apr 2007 p.66]

title: Super Dungeon Bros
review: Super Dungeon Bros is a strange case. Its a pretty good dungeon crawler with decent variety in its gameplay and enough of a fun factor in its scrappy multiplayer to keep you interested. However the rock theme is underplayed; it lends the game some personality but is largely ignored leading to a muddled presentation. Some bugs also hold it back and the online side isnt very healthy right now but this could still be a fun distraction in couch co-op with a few friends.

title: Omerta: City of Gangsters
review: While Omerta has a great gangster style with the black and white photos and jazz music the gameplay itself feels more like work than playing a videogame. The animations in the fighting scenes are stiff and the only thing that changes when your influence on Atlantic City grows are the emblems above the houses. All missions start up slow and especially in the first few hours you are constantly waiting for your henchmen to finish their task.

title: MLB Slugfest 20-04
review: A so-so system that doesnt offer enough action to counter the lack of depth. [Summer 2003 p.49]

title: ECW Anarchy Rulz
review: Things just dont feel quite right and even if you like the controls the AI still cheats too much the same boring combinations still lead to wins and crowd involvement still takes precedence over inherent skill.

title: Star Wars The Clone Wars: Republic Heroes
review: This new Star Wars videogame doesnt make the most of the new generation power but also is a boring and dull action game with no variety in its contents.

title: Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z
genres: Horror | Action Adventure | General | Horror | Survival | Linear
review: Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z gets to the point: action zombies and katanas for hackn slash lovers delight. Team Ninja and comcept managed to avoid making a boring game although Yaiba is perhaps quite short and suffers from a lack of variety.

title: America's Army: True Soldiers
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Even with a solid multiplayer though theres no reason for Americas Army: True Soldiers to be priced and marketed in the same class as other AAA FPS games available on the Xbox 360.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: It is a shame that the game is not as good as the movie it is based on. This is a simple and repetitive shooter that offers little incentive for those players who dont follow the adventures of the young wizard.

title: The Golden Compass
review: It is a great disappointment that The Golden Compass for the NDS should be so sub-par.

title: Myst
review: Quite why they didnt simply make a new Myst specifically for the DS is the real mystery. [Feb 2008 p.84]

title: Dead or Alive Xtreme 3: Fortune
review: If youre coming here for the gameplay forget Dead or Alive Xtreme 3 as nothing has evolved on that topic for the last decade. If you want to peep at sexy girls youre in the right place as everything was made with this goal in mind. A game to store on the ecchi shelf.

title: Surgeon Simulator: Experience Reality
review: It’s largely the same hilarious gory surgery sim you know and love but its mechanics dont translate well to VR.

title: Cruis'n  Exotica
review: Playing Exotica requires very little skill or finesse but for the casual gamer who doesnt want to commit lots of time to racing a track thats not really a bad thing.

title: Backyard Wrestling 2: There Goes the Neighborhood
review: Movement feels floaty hit detection and collision issues are everywhere and enemy AI is painfully stupid. [Jan 2005 p.118]

title: Dead Alliance
review: With the original premise of being able to use the hordes of zombies in your favor to massacre on the enemy comes Dead Alliance. A competitive shooter in which you can test your reflexes and ability as long as you can overlook their technical and visual impairments.

title: Will of Steel
review: You are indeed going to need a Will of Steel to play this game merely because it takes tremendous patience to put up with terrible AI.

title: Aliens: Colonial Marines
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Aliens are back in the videogame scene. However this game does little justice to the film series and lags behind in technical aspects when compared to other current titles. Nonetheless the different game modes –competitive and cooperative– will guarantee the fun that the solo campaign is lacking.

title: Rise of the Guardians
review: It sports the charismatic characters from the movie but lacks in variety and player satisfaction. Avoidable.

title: Star Wars The Clone Wars: Republic Heroes
review: Star Wars The Clone Wars: Republic Heroes looks like a previous-gen title and doesnt convince content-wise either. A lousy camera stubborn controls make the eternal stream of lives a must. It feels kiddy and your friends AI is so bad that you thank the heavens for its co-op ability. With the sheer volume of hit games coming we fear that Lucas wont be able to find a lot of gamers willing to purchase this game.

title: Tron
review: The Xbox Live Arcade release of Tron hobbles this absolute arcade classic with some technical problems.

title: Farscape: The Game
review: A must-have for hardcore fans of the show (both of them). But for anyone else itll just be a very boring extra-long episode. [Nov 2002 p.122]

title: Justice League Heroes
review: A disappointment considering that the Xbox PS2 and GBA versions are so much fun to blaze through.

title: Gardening Mama 2: Forest Friends
review: This gardening themed spin-off carries over all the issues with the main chapter of Cooking Mama. Theres no depth in the minigames and player progression and that doesnt help an overall uninteresting offer.

title: Ben 10: Omniverse
genres: Role-Playing | Massively Multiplayer Online | Fantasy | Action | General | General
review: It feels as though all creativity and imagination has been shunned during development and the result is a load of lethargic combat with too many flaws and complete lack of the details and polish that define the best games of the genre.

title: Hot Wheels: Beat That!
review: And while the game is generally fun its strictly for casual arcade racing-style fans. [Jan 2008 p.69]

title: TMNT: Mutant Melee
review: If you have to see what its about for yourself rent it before purchasing and above all else… find a friend.

title: Naughty Bear
review: Naughty Bear is an amazing character in an average game. Some technical flaw and some dull mechanic ruins the appeal of the game.

title: Bliss Island
review: Its at times a blissful experience and at times a total joy but at others its frustrating and shallow.

title: Jeremy McGrath Supercross 2000
review: Supercross 2000 is just bland. The game lacks real variety.

title: Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark
review: While far from the worst Transformers game Rise of the Dark Sparks interesting ideas are eclipsed by bland action and frustrating design.

title: Funk of Titans
review: Good ideas and a fun artistic approach for a game which is sometimes boring.

title: RollerCoaster Tycoon World
review: RollerCoaster Tycoon World is a pale shadow of the past RollerCoaster Tycoon 3. The rollercoaster editor works well but it is also the only good element of the game.

title: Air Conflicts: Vietnam
review: Unless you’re dying for a game set in Vietnam there’s no great need to play this.

title: Asphalt 3D
genres: Driving | Racing | General | General | Arcade | Automobile
review: A surprisingly good instalment. Well worth a look if you see it for 20 quid or so. [Apr 2011 p.90]

title: Fast Draw Showdown
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Light Gun | Light Gun | Modern
review: Its rubbish fun. [Mar 2010 p.94]

title: NBA Live 14
genres: Arcade | Sports | Traditional | Team | Basketball | Arcade
review: NBA Live 14 delivers an unambitious sporadically exciting basketball simulation held back by its slavish adherence to replicating the televised game.

title: Dynasty Warriors 6
review: So yeah if you have an option skip the PS2 version for the 360 copy.

title: Justice League: Chronicles
review: Chronicles has some of the most unresponsive controls Ive experienced in a long time.

title: Ice Age: Continental Drift - Arctic Games
review: Theres no denying that it has enough tournament action to keep easily pleased fans happy. [Oct 2012 p.92]

title: Naughty Bear
review: Naughty Bear is an amazing character in an average game. Some technical flaw and some dull mechanic ruins the appeal of the game.

title: Deadfall Adventures
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: We find a bunch of good ideas crashing among them. Its hard to recommend this game but we really hope they find the way to make it work in a possible sequel.

title: Furu Furu Park
review: Not all of them are hits; however there are a couple of gems that deserve being rediscovered.

title: Battle: Los Angeles
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The game lacks variety but it also doesnt outstay its welcome. If you want some laughs and dont mind that the shooting experience is average at best playing through this alien invasion is probably more entertaining than the movie and youll get some Achievements/Trophies out of it.

title: Rengoku: The Tower of Purgatory
review: With its minimalist aesthetic and focus on customization and combat at the expense of all else Rengoku might leave a lot of curious PSP owners cold. But for those gamers looking for something a little further afield than the latest racing or sports update this niche experience is most definitely worth looking at.

title: WWE 2K20
review: The game is flat-out broken right now and unlike Matt Hardy I don’t think the lake of reincarnation can help it. It needs some time to be fixed up and lots of it. Fortunately 2K through their WWEGames Twitter account maintains that patches are coming in the next few weeks – so if those come out and fix things up grab the game then. Until then you can safely skip 2K20 and it’s a shame because conceptually it’s got a lot of improvements – but the final product just doesn’t live up to its potential.

title: Mindjack
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Modern | Arcade
review: Mindjack teaches us that a good concept doesnt always evolve into a good game. Square Enix should really think about all the mistakes theyve made if they ever want to create a successor.

title: Enki
review: Enki is presented as a repeatable horror experience but fails both the repeatable and the horror parts. The publicized randomization system affects just the displacements of key objects and the whole experience is over in about 50 minutes far less than the price point of 10 Euros my suggest.

title: The Legend of Alon D'ar
review: If theres a legend here its that this title fails to raise your heartbeat in almost any way. [Mar 2002 p.79]

title: Jeremy McGrath Supercross 2000
review: Has everything needed for a great game but unfortunately fails to produce in the end.

title: Venetica
review: A compelling enough adventure spoilt by shonky controls and shonkier visuals. [Feb 2011 p.93]

title: One Piece: Romance Dawn
review: We feel sorry to see that a great publisher like Namco Bandai in possession of a good license such as One Piece produced such a mediocre title which will be attractive only to the hardcore fans of the series and especially the younger among them.

title: Game Tycoon
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Where Game Tycoon falters is in its lack of depth and variety. Although the concept and myriad of options I described in the paragraph above are intriguing there isn’t a whole lot to it beyond clicking check boxes on the screen and managing company economics.

title: Iron Man
review: The chaotic levels are challenging but they become far too repetitive far too quickly.

title: Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime
genres: Action Adventure | Modern | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | General
review: Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime is recommended only for the lovers of the films with friends to play. The AI is frustrating the design really poor and repetitive. This time the Ghostbusters have failed.

title: Stormrise
review: The imprecise controls bad AI and a completely missing overview make this game more hassle than fun. Stormrise raises a storm – of frustration!

title: Star Trek The Video Game
review: An unoriginal example of an archaic form of entertainment.

title: Touhou Kobuto V: Burst Battle
review: A funny and interesting game based on Touhou characters which as a fighting game is really curious but lacks on its rooster with only 9 characters and contents to maintain interest on it.

title: Mission: Impossible: Operation Surma
review: A mild diversion rather than the full-blown stealth spy-thriller it could have been. At times I had fun but most of the time I was turned off by the frustrating gameplay and slow pacing of the action.

title: Dino Island
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Has the potential to be a truly unique sim but its got the blocky aesthetics of an edutainment title yet is too complex for junior to play on his own. [Sept 2002 p.85]

title: Jazz and Faust
review: Still if you like sweet genteel heroes who absolutely cannot die and humorous third-person adventure games filled with inventory puzzles and devoid of gore its certainly worth the price of admission.

title: The Sopranos: Road to Respect
review: The framerate chugs from time to time and the controls feel looser than the strippers at the Bada Bing. Still the story and dialogue had me laughing out loud a few times. If you are a big fan of the show it is worth a look but don’t expect much.

title: Final Fight: Streetwise
review: Unfortunately the end result is a little more Rambo a lot less Rocky. Its going to take a rethinking to pull the 3D brawler out of its me too phase and Streetwise certainly isnt helping.

title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
genres: Action | General | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Arcade
review: The game is a much better rental or title that is best left to borrowing from a friend who was fooled into buying it due to their ‘80’s nostalgia.

title: Fear Effect Sedna
review: The whole affair feels sort of perfunctory.

title: Block Factory
review: Block Factory is an attempt to do something different and it manages it competently while using some of 3DS functionality well. However more than anything its a greatest hits package of some existing block-dropping games with creation options that feel limited. With more fleshed out customisation even on a stylistic level alone it could have been something much bigger than it is.

title: Time and Eternity
genres: Role-Playing | Console-style RPG | Console-style RPG | Japanese-Style
review: A so-so JRPG with neat ideas and a unique graphical conception but it also has lots of technical problems and annoying battles too.

title: MC Groovz Dance Craze
review: The things I liked about the game overwhelmed what I didnt like. If you want a high score you cant be a stiff. You have to get into the groove and use your whole body.

title: Bloodforge
review: Still if you can stick with it and become accustomed to the way you are forced to rely on instinct there is a pretty fun and solid game here. The barrier to entry is just too high to recommend it to everyone.

title: ArchLord
genres: Role-Playing | Massively Multiplayer Online | Massively Multiplayer | Fantasy | Fantasy
review: Given a year or so Archlord might be a solid title. Right now though? Its not worth the money.

title: Contra: Rogue Corps
review: The game is a failed attempt to bring back this mythical saga. The title innovates with several game modes that are affected by its bad gameplay and input lag. Also noteworthy is its poor graphic section and its acceptable sound section.

title: Nickelodeon Kart Racers
review: Graphically the game looks quite dated. The music is well bad — and the effects while capturing some of the characters’ uniqueness is still pretty flat. Likewise in general for the game while there is some fun to be had especially in local multiplayer the overall experience is more underwhelming than not. That makes this game very difficult to recommend to all but the most ardent kart racing or Nickelodeon fans. Even within those camps who are more apt to overlook flaws with NKR the experience leaves a lot to be desired.

title: Coraline
review: A dark fantasy adventure stripped of darkness fantasy and well adventure. [July 2009 p.71]

title: Beyond the Law: The Third Wave
review: The concept is all there but some features such as funds management background story and sounds are only half-baked and appear as if the developers lost interest in completing the title.

title: Clash of the Titans
review: The fact that the game attempts to surpass the standard tie-in speaks volumes. [Issue#60 p.96]

title: Brave: A Warrior's Tale
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Platformer | General | Historic | 3D
review: Brave is obviously designed with children new to gaming in mind but even they shouldn’t tolerate this glitchy mess. There’s a pretty good game here hiding amongst the bugs graphical issues and poorly designed platforming sequences. It’s called Brave: Search for Spirit Dancer and you can find it for a very reasonable price for the PS2.

title: Zumba Fitness: Join the Party
review: If you dont mind solo workouts Zumba Fitness delivers in spades. [Jan 2011 p.79]

title: Turning Point: Fall of Liberty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Overall Turning Point: Fall of Liberty is game which had some fantastic ideas and concepts. Unfortunately the great ideas did not transform into a solid shooter.

title: Family Party: 30 Great Games
review: As far as mini-games on Wii go Family Party: 30 Great Games is an above average effort. That may not be saying much but if youre looking for something to entertain your friends on occasion you certainly could do a whole lot worse.

title: SPRay
review: Its impossible to recommend as a purchase due to a handful of flaws that have a major negative impact on the gameplay. At On the same token its bursting with great platforming ideas that rival gamings top franchises. If youre curious we suggest a rental but beware of inevitable frustration.

title: KURSK
review: Jujubee S.A.’s efforts in creating a different narrative style is admirable and they did a great job in designing a solid atmosphere and a dynamic environment. But when it comes to presenting a video game inspired by real historical events KURSK falls a little bit short and besides that the core gameplay is not really entertaining either.

title: Hello Neighbor
review: Hello Neighbor is a confused game that doesn’t do much to entice those that are new to the experience. There’s a lack of structure in both the story and the gameplay. This alone makes much of the pace rely heavily on trial and error and although there’s a wide variety of different puzzles to work out the delivery of each of them can be mind boggling if you miss out on a single detail.

title: Steel Horizon
review: Steel Horizon works well as a mainstream DS release but does not have the intransigent components of a cutthroat strategy game. Its combat is too simplistic.

title: Stranger
review: Part of me feels the need to defend this game as I find myself almost feeling sorry for it. Its like a well-meaning kid that because of inadequate parents didnt get the break it deserves.

title: Rock Revolution
review: Rock Revolution is basically what you’d expect from a musical game at medium level.

title: MX vs. ATV Supercross Encore
review: Like the original version MX vs ATV Supercross Encore is really boring and the lack of innovation makes it quite pointless.

title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation: Fatal Conspiracy
review: With Fatal Conspiracy it is as if Telltale forgot what made Sam & Max Monkey Island and Wallace and Gromit so successful in the console world and it comes off as a sorry port of a lackluster PC game.

title: Go! Sports Skydiving
review: The visuals are generally clean and bright while the audio is made up of your generic menu music and a series of beeps and tones when instructed to move or perform a certain action.

title: Prison Break: The Conspiracy
review: The television series is great but the game isn’t. The main aspects are stealth gameplay fighting and quick time events. Only the stealth part works in this game the other two don’t. The graphics are nice and the audio is fine. The voice-acting could have been better but overall it’s good to listen to.

title: Smashing Drive
review: You can drop a few quarters at the local arcade or half a Benjamin for the home version and still beat the game in one sitting. [June 2002 p.120]

title: ATV: Quad Power Racing
review: The graphics may be lackluster but the music is worse.

title: TMNT
review: Middle-of-the-road DS gaming thats not offensive or horrible - just not very good. [May 2007 p.83]

title: Arcania: The Complete Tale
genres: PC-style RPG | Western-Style | Role-Playing | General | Action RPG
review: ArcaniA has an expansive world to explore. Unfortunately theres almost nothing of interest to find there and youll likely leave unsatisfied.

title: Xiaolin Showdown
review: A lack of imagination in terms of game mechanics doomed it to the rental bin and not the permanent collection.

title: Tennis World Tour
review: With a great base that reminds Top Spin Tennis World Tour presents more errors than they should with a game that seems in progress.

title: Hellboy: The Science of Evil
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Beat-'Em-Up | Beat-'Em-Up | Linear
review: A hastily made not much fun not worth the money movie add-on. Youre better off buying a box of Hellboy Cornflakes.

title: Spider-Man 2: The Game
review: The problem with Spiderman 2 is its lack of depth.

title: Star Trek: Shattered Universe
review: While the actually gameplay is without much issue it borrows heavily from other games particularly the Rogue Squadron series making its mission-based gameplay highly unoriginal and trite.

title: Iron Man 2
review: Iron Man 2 is better than your average movie game but its still rather short and limited in scope. The visuals are great and the controls work well but I have a feeling HVS couldve done a lot more with the property if they had more time to work on the game.

title: Winter Sports 2: The Next Challenge
genres: Sports | Alternative | Individual | Skiing | Skiing | Ski / Snowboard
review: Winter Sports 2009 simply does the job. It is easy to play and offers a fair amount of entertainment – and at a welcome bargain price that will appeal to many sports fans. However with poor presentation values and only a handful of really fun or challenging events it’s a game you’ll be unlikely to dig out on a regular basis unless you’ve an unquenchable thirst for competition or a few mates up for some multiplayer action.

title: Deca Sports 3
review: There is some fun to be had in Deca Sports 3 and its a sure-fire hit at parties. Not a hard-core sports simulator but some lesser-known sports that dont get the full retail package are also nice to find here.

title: Rugby 18
review: Rugby 2018 is lacking the depth to reach the level of the best sports games.

title: Legacy: Dark Shadows
review: My advice: Set aside a larger budget for voice acting and make sure the environments are as interactive toward the end as they are in the beginning. For players dont expect a classic because you wont find this game fulfilling that need. But as long as you set your expectations a bit lower you should be entertained.

title: Planet of the Apes
review: The lack of a mid-game save aside PoA is great fun to play - not only does it have the necessary hook to keep you interested in what happens next but it manages to perfectly reproduce the atmosphere of the Apes films.

title: Iron Man 2
review: A twisted shrine to mediocrity. [Aug 2010 p.104]

title: Wayward Manor
review: My time with Wayward Manor felt more like a trial than a macabre puzzle adventure about a haunted house. Wayward Manor isn’t frightening but it sure scared me away.

title: Things on Wheels
review: A lot of little flaws suck most of the fun out of this take on radio-controlled car racing.

title: Cyberball 2072
review: American Football fans looking for a cheap retro fix will probably squeeze 400 points worth of fun out of Cyberball before déjà vu sets in but the absence of any real multiplayer challenge means any amusement comes with a built-in expiry date one that arrives sooner than youd like. Its no Speedball thats for sure.

title: Transformers: Cybertron Adventures
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Arcade
review: Transformers is a funny rail shooter with nice graphics and four different weapons you can use to shot your enemies during two available campaigns. The problem is the game is way too easy as you can finish it in a few hours. It also lacks any form of progression or power-ups.

title: 25 to Life
review: If you have Live this can be an incredibly enjoyable game once you get used to the profane and immature nature of players that frequent the lobbies.

title: Arcania: Fall of Setarrif
genres: Role-Playing | PC-style RPG | General | Action RPG | PC-style RPG
review: Its very short but we still had to force ourselves to play on. Dumb non-stop battles oversized dungeons and a tiring story is basically all there is. Think twice before buying this one.

title: Mana Khemia: Student Alliance
review: Because of the wide RPG library in PS2 and PSP and sspecially in PS2 during his ten years of life Mana Khemia can sneak modestly between hardcore Atelier Iris fans. There are not many surprises in this game which is too conservative but can offer some hours of fun.

title: Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Technically Damnation is not up to date it looks like a game from the 20th century with overly complicated controls. Its a shame because it could have been so much better. Blue Omega please try again.

title: One Way Trip
review: One Way Trip is the story of a definite and unjust death sentence told amongst an eerily realistic dissociative drug trip backdrop that freaked my delicate mind more than once. Basic disjointed and tragic this game strips away almost all functions of a game and makes you a decision maker. Plagued with crashes that can cause fatal errors One Way Trip does have some improvements to make. With those improvements and time One Way Trip is sure to become a cult favorite of the PlayStation 4 age.

title: Alien Blast: The Encounter
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi
review: Aliens Blast: The Encounter never makes any pretense toward being anything other than it is a simple straightforward shoot ‘em up extravaganza and depending upon whether or not this is your cup of tea will be the major factor in your purchase decision.

title: Robot Arena
review: While its prettier than most budget titles it also suffers from the vacancy that so often comes with nice looking people dogs or mechanical monsters. It looks great standing still but give it a complicated task and it all goes to pieces.

title: Rally Challenge 2000
review: Its not a miserable game by any stretch -- the bad fogging can be worked around the sad audio can be drowned out without missing anything and the lacking tracks are at least true to the sport.

title: Emergency Heroes
genres: Driving | Racing | Mission-based | Arcade | Mission-based | Automobile
review: More suited to a younger audience. It wears thin after a while but cheap thrills can easily tempt you back. [Issue#25 p.77]

genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Arcade
review: 7554 deserves brownie points for trying to break the mold. Instead of the overused US invasion of 1965 the developers chose 1954 – the final year of the First Indochina War. Too bad this is the only original idea in the entire game. 7554 is just a carbon copy of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare sans multiplayer.

title: GT Pro Series
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | GT / Street | GT / Street | Automobile
review: A poor excuse for a racing game. The only good thing is the wheel that comes with the game. Using it is actually quite fun. [Jan 2007]

title: Timeline
review: Sadly much of the game feels as if it were rushed and the games story and characters are presented so poorly as to all but ruin what could have an enjoyable experience.

title: MotionSports Adrenaline
review: Ubisoft had great hopes and ambition when planning and creating MotionSports Adrenaline but when an fast paced extreme sports game has unresponsive controls it leaves you feeling very let down and frustrated.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: As movie tie-ins go this is a decent effort - but youd need to have downed your body weight in butter-beer to claim that it didnt need a little more care attention and (perhaps) experience in its creation.

title: The Golden Compass
review: Theres no reason to play The Golden Compass unless the movie or book absolutely monopolizes your imagination. [Jan 2008 p.62]

title: Gungrave VR
review: Gungrave like when it debuted over a decade ago is an acquired taste.

title: Waking
review: Waking probably wont resonate with most - its far too oblique and mixed for most and its complicated art for weirdos. But as one of those weirdos I found Jason Odas unique thesis on life death and everything between the two to be an engaging engrossing and challenging experience.

title: JASF: Jane's Advanced Strike Fighters
review: From the first mission to the last J.A.S.F. is left to rot by the arcadey and capable Ace Combat for sheer thrills embarrassed by the variety of missions offered in H.A.W.X. 2 and technically outperformed by the more serious IL-2 Sturmovik. [February 2012 p.76]

title: Taito Legends Power-Up
review: Cheap cheerful and a good laugh even if it does lack a little longevity.

title: Rapala Tournament Fishing!
review: Rapala Tournament Fishings controls just arent intuitive and worse theyre not especially responsive.

title: DARK
genres: Action Adventure | Modern | General | Modern | Linear
review: DARK is a stealth game with some nice ideas and an interesting story but it suffers from poor IA and repetitive gameplay.

title: Seduce Me
review: My main issue with Seduce Me is that despite the invitation that is right there in the title of the game none of the characters want to cooperate. No matter how high your score with a character - and hence your implied closeness to that character - they still play as though they want you to fail.

title: Lets Fish! Hooked On
review: Considering it has no competition… Lets Fish! Hooked On is surely the best fishing game available for the PlayStation Vita and fans of the genre (like myself) may enjoy it for a little while. Even with the Vitas bells and whistles however it fails to live up to the Sega-style arcade fishing games of old.

title: Brigade E5: New Jagged Union
review: My instinct is that despite BE5’s flaws it might have potential for modding or for higher quality sequels.

title: Turtle Tale
review: At its low price point Turtle Tale is an entirely functional platforming adventure from a small indie studio that you can breeze through in a day or two.

title: Street Supremacy
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | GT / Street | GT / Street | Automobile
review: The structure is here for a great title but it doesnt help when half the games gone up in smoke. [Apr 2006 p.135]

title: Dragon's Lair
genres: Action | Adventure | Interactive Movie | General | Arcade | Interactive Movie
review: The game will be delightfully nostalgic to gamers of old and should be tried by anyone who is too young to remember it. Its an important part of gaming history one that will make a fine addition to your Xbox LIVE Arcade game collection.

title: American Idol
review: Nothing more than an unpolished but promising rhythm title. [Feb 2004 p.103]

title: 101-in-1 Sports Party Megamix
review: Theyre actually playable (for the most part) and dont feel rushed or broken. [Christmas 2010 p.91]

title: 007 Legends
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: A fun shooter collecting the best moments out of five classic James Bond movies on one disc. Then again the gameplay has aged the graphics are terrible and both loading times and enemy AI are major disappointments. There are better alternatives on the shooter market thats for sure.

title: Mall Tycoon
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Building your own galleria is fun for a bit but because its such a simple economic simulation theres just no staying power here.

title: Duke Nukem: Manhattan Project
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Scrolling | Shoot-'Em-Up | Sci-Fi | Horizontal
review: Dated gameplay and gags. [Sept 2010 p.81]

title: Clash of the Titans
review: It isnt great but its quite a fun distraction and far better than most other movie-games. [Issue#193 p.95]

title: 0 Day Attack on Earth
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: While the concept of the game seems to be sound a Geometry Wars inspired co-op shooter; everything seems to work against it especially the price.

title: Iron Man 2
review: A twisted shrine to mediocrity. [Aug 2010 p.104]

title: Dollhouse
review: Dollhouse begins with a lot of potential but after a few levels of repetitive gameplay the horror elements start to lose their impact. What starts as a trip through a disturbed mind quickly becomes monotonous and Maries story suffers as a result.

title: Star Trek: Shattered Universe
review: This game is aggressive and unstoppable in its mediocrity.

title: Nickelodeon Kart Racers
review: In the end Nickelodeon Kart Racers is just kind of passable (and compared to others Im being generous with it). [Issue #37 – January/February 2019 p. 75]

title: Way of the Dogg
review: Way of the Dogg is a wasted opportunity. As someone who consumes pretty much all the media on offer in this game it doesnt even appeal to me which should tell you that somethings wrong. Its a shame because with an M rating and a little more plot tweaking this could have been something special. Someone call the popo -- this game just did a 187 on your wallet foo.

title: 4PM
review: The brain behind (Bojan Brbora) 4PM deserves a lot of credit for what he has attempted to achieve but when all is said and done this feels more like a proof of concept than a fully realised game.

title: WWII Aces
review: This is a third-party game with not very high aspirations. Don’t let the Wing Series emblem on the cover fool you into thinking that it is official or historically accurate or anything of the sort.

title: Delta Force: Xtreme 2
genres: Action | General | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Modern | Modern
review: Xtreme 2 succeeds as a budget game - it just doesn’t cater to any audience in particular. A lack of focus is the overarching problem with this decent budget title.

title: Slain!
review: The discrepancy between visual and game design couldn’t be bigger. While the pixelart is simply beautiful throughout the fighting mechanics and collision detection need an overhaul.

title: Alekhine's Gun
review: It is hardly a spy thriller but rather a madhouse with disguises and murders so it’s best to avoid this chapter of Mr. Strogov’s life altogether.

title: Tank Beat
genres: Action | Simulation | General | General | Vehicle | Combat
review: Its a cleverly designed game that could use a bit more polish.

title: The Polar Express
review: The games quick pacing ensures that youll never be bored. [Jan 2005 p.138]

title: Around the World in 80 Days
review: The only adventure youll have with it is trying to get your money back should you be so unlucky to have purchased it.

title: Evil Dead: Hail to the King
review: If you havent seen the game prepare to witness some of the weakest graphics this side of the millenium. The 3D characters are nothing but big blocks of pixel.

title: Naval Assault: The Killing Tide
review: Naval Assault – The killing tide should have been an arcade game. It would have been a good advice to 505 Games to do so. But they decided to release it as a full-price game. But for this it is too simple and its gameplay is too stupid.

title: The Chaos Engine (2013)
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Top-Down
review: With so many great ideas in The Chaos Engine it pains me to admit that I didnt have much fun. I love the world it creates the diverse enemies and the science fiction story but cant get past the punishing difficulty and cheap hits. This enhanced version needs a few more enhancements to be ready for the 21st century!

title: Space Raiders
review: The gamplay is simple but well-executed and just as much fun as it was in the eraly 80s. [June 2004 p.121]

title: Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
review: Its banality is perfect. Even an inexplicable side-scrolling fish-tank shoot-em-up level that pops up between the soporific platform stages fails to raise an eyebrow.

title: Ducati World Racing Challenge
review: Theres plenty to enjoy about Ducati Racing which ultimately picks up for all of the minor gripes.

title: Ace Banana
review: I felt there was very little content here to keep me coming back other than the novel feeling of the bow and arrow which is absolutely amazing in fact. Aside from this and maybe the visual style I don’t see a huge reason I’d return to it especially if other games adopt this bow and arrow feel. Yet at the same time I can’t complain it’s a simply game with colorful graphics and is appropriate for players of all ages. Just don’t expect it to kill hours of time.

title: DRIV3R
genres: Driving | Action Adventure | Racing | Mission-based | Arcade | Mission-based | Open-World | Automobile
review: It’s not that it’s that bad of a game it’s just that most of what’s under the hood on this one has been done before.

title: Screwjumper!
review: While most will likely balk at the idea of spending 800 Microsoft Space Bucks for this title I find it quite refreshing and reminiscent of the PSOne days where devs took chances on titles that didn’t really fit a genre.

title: Made Man: Confessions of the Family Blood
review: Vietnam veteran Joey Verolla is a really really tough guy who can not only lift two kalashnikovs but also fire them simultaneously. And he does this trick with any other handgun even SPAS. If it doesnt properly impress his enemies its because they are brainless. As is the entire game - despite some interesting mission designs quite amusing (and gory) finishing sequences and virtually useless ability to seek cover by putting your back to the wall this shooter is as simple as some precursors of the genre. [March 2008]

title: Chronus Arc
review: Chronus Arc is competent RPG that fails to deliver on one of the most important aspects of the genre: the story.

title: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DON'T KNOW!
review: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DONT KNOW! does a great job of managing and working with the story characters and feel of the franchise but unfortunately doesnt have the gameplay to match especially at a $40 retail price. If youre interested in the narrative and the chance to play as your favorite characters wait for the price to come down to $15-20 more in keeping with the kind of downloadable title this game feels like.

title: Emergency Mayhem
genres: Driving | Racing | Mission-based | Arcade | Mission-based | Automobile
review: However if you are a fan of classic arcade driving games like Segas aforementioned cabbie title then you may want to check Mayhem out. It can definitely entertain even if only for minutes at a time.

title: Protothea
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Scrolling | Scrolling | Shoot-'Em-Up | Vertical
review: Protothea is a totally hardcore shooter that while challenging just isnt very interesting. The one unique aspect is its control scheme but I cant say its an improvement over two analog sticks. The game doesnt look that great doesnt sound that great and doesnt offer much creativity.

title: Psychotoxic
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: How much you enjoy that gameplay is going to be based on your love of the genre and your tolerance for numerous glitches. Hopefully a patch is in the works to improve things or at least fix what’s broke.

title: ShellShock 2: Blood Trails
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Third-Person | Historic | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: The sequel to the controversial Vietnam first person shooter abandoned the use of torture and atrocities to civilians. It also abandoned good graphics atmosphere and almost everything else needed for a good game. Dumb enemies exaggerated splatter effects boring levels and graphics right from the last century - Shellshock 2 has nothing interesting to offer.

title: Underground Pool
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: With presentation thats lacking flair no tournament options sub-standard opponent AI no rule variations other than 8 or 9 ball pool and limited stimuli to continue playing Frontline Studios appear to have just gone through the motions with Actua Pool.

title: Freedom: First Resistance
review: If you enjoy puzzle-oriented RPGs or the Freedom series you might enjoy this game. Otherwise it should stay on the shelf.

title: Eureka Seven Vol. 2: The New Vision
review: This sequel simply didnt need to happen. [June 2007 p.80]

title: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DON'T KNOW!
review: Fans will get a kick out of it but anyone else would be advised to try the glorious cartoon instead. [Jan 2014 p.83]

title: Xiaolin Showdown
review: Xiaolin Showdown has the elements of a good game but the execution is so sloppy and shallow that it ends up falling flat.

title: Painkiller: Hell & Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Painkiller Hell & Damnation is a short unattractive beast that will sink its claws into you if you give it half a chance. But be warned: it could also be a throwback that may fly right over the head of a modern FPS gamer. [September 2013 p76]

title: Farming Simulator
review: Fans of farming might enjoy this but if youre not particularly fond of agriculture we wouldnt recommend this game. To be sure its an incredibly deep experience but sheer depth does not prevent a title like this from growing stale within a couple of hours. Repetitive gameplay outright bizarre physics and mediocre visuals dont help either.

title: Escape Dead Island
genres: Action Adventure | Adventure | 3D | Survival | Third-Person | Modern
review: Escape Dead Island is a decent game but nothing more (though also nothing less).

title: Inner Chains
review: Inner Chains has been a big opportunity wasted. Its true that its a relatively small indie studio that its a project with a very specific vision and that has really new features that are also great but the final result has more the look of an unfinished beta than a totally finished game.

title: The Warriors: Street Brawl
review: A little bit ropey. [Issue#52 p.104]

title: Brain Boost: Gamma Wave
review: If you’re going to get one of these go for the faster-paced Beta Wave but watch out for that nasty addition game.

title: MTV Sports: Skateboarding featuring Andy Macdonald
review: Very entertaining.

title: Zatch Bell! Mamodo Fury
review: Mamodo Fury packs a number of gameplay modes and plenty of familiar characters but it all feels wasted on this shallow and frustrating fighting game.

title: Blood Drive
genres: Simulation | Driving | Racing | General | General | Vehicle | Combat
review: Just some generic cars running over some ho-hum zombies. The controls could be tighter and no one seems to be playing online but the game succeeds at giving you a license to run over the undead. It just isnt that exciting.

title: Prison Break: The Conspiracy
review: Despite the stiff stealth/fighting mechanics the mission’s linearity and the trial/error experience Prison Break: The Conspiracy somehow ended up being enjoyable. I’m sure Zootfly could have done something much better but in the end the final product was purposely done with the intention of giving the fans something incredibly easy to play.

title: Freestyle Street Soccer
review: The problems start with control. The response isnt razor sharp the special moves arent spectacular and the Netbuster specials are too easy to pull off. [Jan 2004 p.73]

title: Dragon Ball Z: Taiketsu
review: It has its ups and downs but the special moves look absolutely gorgeous and very much like they do in the cartoon series and the in-flight fighting is an experience not to be missed on a hand-held.

title: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
genres: Action | General | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy
review: Brian and Stewie are funny and there are plenty of gags but the gameplay is nothing crazy and the levels arent super-intriguing.

title: The Golden Compass
review: As in many of these cases if you liked the movie you’ll probably enjoy revisiting the story and characters. But that doesn’t make it a good game. [Jan 2008]

title: Scourge: Outbreak
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Had there been some polish in some of the controls an added depth to the story mode and more matchmaking online Scourge: Outbreak would have been one of the biggest downloadable surprises this year. Still for around $10 it’s worth playing — especially with friends.

title: MotionSports
review: As stated earlier MotionSports: Play For Real is more of a complementary title to Kinect Sports than a competitive one.

title: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Fantasy | Platformer | Fantasy | 3D
review: The gameplay boils down to a simplistic mix of platform jumping and enemy bashing with a good dose of item collection thrown in. It wont tax your reflexes or your brain which is why the game is perfect for younger gamers; players who grew up with the cartoons as I did will also experience a nice feeling of nostalgia as they play.

title: Real Steel
