review: Real Steals fisticuffs are a half step above the usual movie-based dreck but the constant rattle of a beggars tin cup in your face only grows more distasteful over time.

title: Soldier Elite
review: Soldier Elite wants very badly to be a stealth action game but it lacks any understanding of the subtlety and nuance that are essential to the genre.

title: Deep Black: Reloaded
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Arcade
review: For what the game does it works relatively well. There are a few hitches here and there but it was never enough to have me quit playing the game. For a cheaper title you can definitely do a lot worse than Deep Black. If youre looking for a decent little shooter and dont mind a few inconsistencies here and there you might want to check this game out.

title: Battle: Los Angeles
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The game is thirty minutes long and costs ten dollars. Thats thirty three cents a minute to play this game. Youll get better value out of a psychic hotline.

title: Montague's Mount
review: Montagues Mount promises a journey through the mind of a tortured man by the shores of an Irish island and endless emotions. Actually we got an adventure burdened by its design flaws and soft script although it has potential for the future.

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: It follows the beloved storyline with a wonderful cinematic flair top-notch audio design colorful yet simple graphics and a basic set of gameplay mechanics. However a lacking of innovation and overall gameplay and graphical polish stunt the games full potential and leave it as a just-above-average title only fans of the material and/or genre will find any value in.

title: SuperPower
review: Its an idea that has been tried before and done better.

title: The Cursed Crusade
review: Crusade sports some solid ideas (a cursed realm you can switch to on the fly is a neat concept that doesnt quite work) but sadly it suffers most from ho-hum pacing and rinse-repeat gameplay.

title: Ultimate Beach Soccer
review: I was left slightly underwhelmed and rather bored with the entire experience. Sure Ultimate Beach Soccer is new and different and that might be enough to get a few curious gamers to check it out but I doubt it will keep their interest for more than a day or two.

title: Torino 2006 - the Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
review: Commentary will soon get on your tits. [Feb 2006 p.94]

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: The Wii controls add a thin veil to make you feel like youre not just mashing A the entire time but you are. This game is literally you punching as your favorite member of the Fantastic Four for hours on end.

title: Drive Girls
review: Unless you have a strange Transformers fetish it’s a game that you can easily skip.

title: Air Raid: This Is Not a Drill!
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic
review: While the control and gameplay are dead on the repetition and lack of story simply hurt.

title: Army Men: Green Rogue
review: When you consider the Army Men franchises extraordinary commitment to ordinariness then it shouldnt be a surprise that the game is so utterly banal.

title: Turning Point: Fall of Liberty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: After playing through just a bit of Turning Point we were completely disappointed. The old feeling to it completely ruined the original concept.

title: 25 to Life
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: There are a couple of interesting concepts included in the package (customization items for your online avatar are awarded for completing single-player secondary objectives) but the game as a whole never rises above mediocrity.

title: Pocket Racers
review: A decent racer that doesn’t really do anything different enough to warrant passing on any of the quality racing experiences that the PSP offers.

title: Doctor Who: The Eternity Clock
review: Doctor Who fans will get a lot out of the story and excellent voice acting and motion capture but only gamers with a high tolerance for frustration will find the fun buried in this one.

title: Wacky Races: Crash & Dash
genres: Driving | Racing | Arcade | Kart | Other | Kart
review: Although the visuals and sound are solid enough the gameplay fails as the racing view itself is very strange and the controls are too simplistic and too dull to make it an exciting game.

title: Troll and I
review: While the team’s modest size is betrayed by the game’s myriad technical issues what they’ve attempted here is quite honestly laudable. Maybe they’d do well to view this as a functional blueprint for a future project that builds on the good work that’s been accomplished—I know I’ll be waiting for what’s next. Here’s hoping the bugs get patched out and that we eventually get a Troll and I sequel one that focuses on cleaner controls and a more emotionally engaging story.

title: Senran Kagura Reflexions
review: Senran Kagura Reflexions is an Ecchi dating sim game that in reality is a touching and squeezing simulator. The gameplay feels pervy at times and gets repetitive and boring fairly quickly. There are no visual issues and motion controls make things more interesting but it unfortunately isnt enough to make it entertaining.

title: RollerCoaster Tycoon 3D
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Nostalgia-seekers need not apply: this is easily outdone by the 13-year-old game from which it is derived. A shame. [Christmas 2012 p.111]

title: Brain Boost: Beta Wave
review: If you’re going to get one of these go for the faster-paced Beta Wave but watch out for that nasty addition game. [Feb. 2007 p.111]

title: The Polar Express
review: The games simplicity makes this a questionable choice for anyone over 8 but young kids will likely enjoy it. [Jan 2005 p.106]

title: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
genres: Action | General | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy
review: Two worlds collide: On one side you get loads of bizarre enemies and hair-raising ideas. On the other you get frustrated by old-fashioned mission design poor AI and boring gunfights. Like Stewie says: Again! Again! I love repetition!

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: Kids and adults will find themselves frustrated with bad camera angles and dimwitted Oompa Loompas.

title: 25 to Life
review: You know the drill: extremely linear level designs that stitch together corridors open areas and dull objectives with all the refinement and subltlety of a drunken quilting circle. [Mar 2006 p.100]

title: Hello Neighbor
review: The Switch port has almost everything going wrong with poor visuals a higher price point than the other platforms and poor use of Switch specific features. In its current state you’re better off either buying it on another platform if you must have it or skip it altogether. I hope the developers can either improve the visuals through patches or work on.

title: Coffeetime Crosswords
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Puzzle | Logic | General
review: This game just lacks in too many ways to cost this much. Should have just been a 400 point game.

title: Ju-on: The Grudge
review: Its a shame its so brief (about the length of an actual horror film) so we cannot recommend paying full price but if you can get it for a budget price itll make for some frightening fun at your next party.

title: Thor: God of Thunder
review: Thor is a very basic game made only for fans of the film.

title: R.I.P.D. The Game
genres: Action | General | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: As a game its just ok but there are some quite frustrating issues –as the cover system– that end up weakening the final experience.

title: Raven Squad: Operation Hidden Dagger
review: Its quite short. The credits were rolling after less than seven hours. The weak presentation is just as annoying as the question why the game deprives the player of lots of exciting situations. There are better games of the genre like Rainbow Six: Vegas.

title: Monsters Inc. Scream Arena
review: Replay value of Scream Arena is low due to its repetitive yet enjoyable gameplay.

title: Anacapri: The Dream
review: The makers should be commended on another fine effort.

title: Onechanbara: Bikini Samurai Squad
review: Its hard to know which is more laughable: Onechanbaras story of sisters who absorb zombie blood through their skin or the fact that this game is so shallow. [Apr 2009 p.81]

title: Tony Hawk's Motion
genres: Sports | Alternative | Individual | Skateboarding | Skateboarding | Skate / Skateboard
review: A shadow of its former success this is little more than a limited showcase for a peripheral. [Feb 2009 p.82]

title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
review: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor isnt without its charms but its hard to believe that the younger target audience will wade through the difficulty spikes to see the convoluted narrative to its conclusion.

title: Cartoon Network Racing
review: Kids will probably love it too as well as some adults that enjoy Cartoon Networks shows and characters.

title: The Deer God
review: The Deer God is a tough sell its visuals and music can’t help make this game any less frustrating. If you have a lot of time and more importantly a lot of patience maybe this game is good for you but as it stands I would stay clear.

title: Coffee Tycoon
review: The casual gamer won’t even dignify this with half a first glance it’s a game to remind yourself that there’s a big wide World out there and you’re missing it!

title: Universal Studios Theme Parks Adventure
review: While not as bad as the majority of critics are reporting its certainly not worthy of a full price title.

title: Resident Evil: Survivor
review: Brilliant. Youll certainly be having a bit of a laugh as well as being scared out of your pants.

title: Realms of Ancient War
review: In conclusion Realms of War is a title that is on the lower side of average in the genre it exists in.

title: Inkheart
review: Not for veteran gamers. Truly engaging puzzle-solving and high quality presentation are absent from the game but its accessible control style and somewhat interesting plot make it at least playable.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5
review: The visuals have their fair amount of issues the gameplay cant quite measure up between the frustrating missions and poorly placed slam technique and the online sessions need a serious overhaul. Its still playable and might be fun for devoted fans for the series but theres no question that a lot more polish couldve gone into Tony Hawks revival.

title: Turn It Around
review: An expansive number of levels plenty of unlockable rewards and a variety of play options - all qualities which tend to make game compilations worth picking up in the first place - are noticeably lacking here.

title: Pacific Rim
review: You might well opt to buy stat upgrades or temporary performance-boosting items instead for the sake of simple one-on-one multiplayer confrontations. But because stat upgrades make little difference in the field and you can carry only a single boost item at a time youre probably better off just playing something else altogether.

title: Alone in the Dark
review: A pale imitation of a far more ambitious game Alone in the Dark on Wii is too higgledy-piggledy to satisfy. A handful of terrific highs cant make up for hours of lows. [Sept 2008 p.58]

title: Star Wars: Flight of the Falcon
review: The graphics system works not too well but every level is playable and enjoyable if it weren’t for having to start over completely after each life.

title: Putty Squad
review: Putty Squad is not a bad game and with the relative lack of titles currently released on the PlayStation 4 it does fill something of a void. Still platforming enthusiasts with PlayStation 4s do have access to Rayman Legends rendering it rather pointless to grab Putty Squad unless youre an absolute genre purist.

title: Motocross Mania 3
review: The title features sub-par racing horrendous graphics lackluster audio and focuses far too much on the weapons gimmick.

title: Burnout Legends
review: Even with the Crash Mode being a let down Burnout Legends is easily one of the best racers on the Nintendo DS. The fact that Criterion has put all the little nuances of the Burnout series in one little DS cart is amazing.

title: Dead or Alive Paradise
review: At best forgettable; at worst downright creepy. [Issue#192 p.89]

title: Battleship
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Board Games | Shooter | Board Games | First-Person | Tactical
review: A title that isnt truly good or bad with aspects that can be fun at times yet which grow boring over the course of its 4 hour lifespan and ultimately it falls just short of being anything more than decidedly average.

title: Battle: Los Angeles
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The game lacks variety but it also doesnt outstay its welcome. If you want some laughs and dont mind that the shooting experience is average at best playing through this alien invasion is probably more entertaining than the movie and youll get some Achievements/Trophies out of it.

title: Attack of the Movies 3D
review: Its a bland and lifeless arcade shooter with repetitive gameplay and unnecessary 3D effects.

title: Painkiller: Resurrection
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Makes a one-man war against the armies of hell quite depressingly dull. [Christmas 2009 p.116]

title: Umbrella Corps
review: It doesn’t feel like it’s finished and even if it were to be further refined it would just be a low-budget Gears of War-style shoot-‘em-up. There’s no reason to play it.

title: G.I. Combat
review: I found the presentation technically impeccable but was not able to sufficiently overcome the difficulty in issuing orders and controlling the camera to derive a lot of enjoyment from the game.

title: Driven
review: More fun than watching the movie that inspired it. Of course so is watching your inbred Uncle Eddie pick lint out of his navel. [Feb 2002 p.85]

title: Pimp My Ride
review: When running properly Pimp my Ride is fun if you’re into the show but it will do little for the gearheads who are looking for something a little different in the racing genre. Snatch this one up if you’re really into the TV show Xzibit or outlandishly customizing cars.

title: Godzilla Unleashed
review: Nearly identical to a game that was released 3 years ago with almost minimal upgrades. Some aspects have even been taken out or downgraded.

title: DARK
genres: Action Adventure | Modern | General | Modern | Linear
review: Awkward design and stiff controls make Dark a royal pain in the... [Sept 2013 p.70]

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: A handful of interesting (although poorly developed) ideas are the only bright spots in a game that disappoints in almost every possible way. Sadly Terminal Reality offers one of the ugliest survival horror games ever.

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows
review: Intrinsic problems with some of the basics; collision detection dodgy camera and sloppy graphics ruin what could have been a far more polished experience.

title: Naruto Shippuden: Dragon Blade Chronicles
review: The repetitive enemies poor environment design and visual slowdown will turn you off so much that youd never give the franchise another chance.

title: Vampire Rain
review: Despite the aforementioned illusion of choice there is really only one pre-determined way to conquer a given mission each stealthy ability in reality a functional button-press to move the game along. [Apr 2007 p.87]

title: Thor: God of Thunder
review: Thor: God of Thunder is an ugly game. The gameplay mechanics do not work properly and a poor visual style subtends the entire walktrough. Boring is the only word to describe this tie-in.

title: Project Root
review: Project Root connect the spirit of the classic shooter with hints of open world . But the result is too uneven because of the many flaws in graphics and game design. Its hard to recommend buying this title albeit at a fairly low price.

title: Carnival Games: Mini-Golf
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Golf | Arcade | Arcade
review: Solid visuals decent golf mechanics and a large assortment of prizes to collect will keep some gamers busy. The game just needs more courses and an expanded single-player mode to really make gamers come back for more.

title: Raven Squad: Operation Hidden Dagger
review: Mediocre. [Nov 2009 p.78]

title: Seven Kingdoms: Conquest
review: If you are hoping for an updated version of the exceptional Seven Kingdoms gameplay in Seven Kingdoms: Conquest you will be seriously disappointed.

title: Kengo: Legend of the 9
review: It just gets kind of boring watching the fights instead of participating in them.

title: The Simpsons Skateboarding
review: Youre better off going with the pro. [Jan 2003 p.52]

title: Blades of Time
review: Outbreak is sort of a fun mode but it does get old quickly and everything surrounding it is unexplained or prone to error messages and I can see it becoming kind of gross in a free-to-play way. Blades of Time is bad and you should not play it.

title: Rock Revolution
review: Rock Revolution is a disaster.

title: Legend of the Dragon
review: Faithful for fans low on thrills for everyone else. [July 2007 p.84]

title: Heavy Fire: Red Shadow
review: All in all Heavy Fire: Red Shadow is a game that is easy to overlook and doesn’t really give you much reason not to. There’s fun to be had and it’s an easy way to waste a half hour but that’s really all you’ll be doing. With repetitive gameplay a strange storyline and a tone that oddly feels more like a recruitment video than anything else Heavy Fire seems like it probably should have stayed dormant. Seriously though if it does unlock a special invite to join the military someone please let me know!

title: SoulCalibur: Lost Swords
review: Rather than being encouraged to play it often feels like Bandai Namco is actively discouraging you from Lost Swords. [Issue#148 p.124]

title: Dying: Reborn
review: Getting stuck in room-escape or point and click adventure games is par for the course sometimes but what DYING: Reborn does not have going for it is other strong qualities to keep things interesting and worth the effort. It wasn’t long before I resorted to a walkthrough once and then again as needed. I wasn’t compelled by the story the characters or the atmosphere. I didn’t feel any sense of tension or immersion with Mathew and his plight. The presentation of the game from graphics to on-screen font to voice-acting was very generic and lackluster too making the whole experience a struggle and not very enjoyable. Without a walkthrough I probably would not have pressed on because I just was not finding the experience worth my time and effort. If you really enjoy room escape games and puzzles DYING: Reborn at $20 or less might be worth a look but it’s hard to recommend otherwise.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Like a Quidditch player falling from a broomstick mid-match this installment loses all forward momentum and goes plummeting toward a faceplant at top speed.

title: Hello Neighbor
review: The basic concept is solid but due to its bad implementation the game is almost a total write-off.

title: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal
review: Acme Arsenal has its fun moments but only if you dont think too hard. [Dec 2007 p.89]

title: ECW Anarchy Rulz
review: One of the deepest games ever created. Too bad all the time spent with the options couldnt have been devoted to gameplay instead.

title: Left Behind: Eternal Forces
review: Unfortunately the inconsistent behavior of your recruits means youll spend more time fighting the interface than the Antichrist.

title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
review: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor isnt without its charms but its hard to believe that the younger target audience will wade through the difficulty spikes to see the convoluted narrative to its conclusion.

title: Evolution Snowboarding
review: There is a brain-dead appeal to the desperate way Konami has reinvented its struggling ESPN Winter X-Games Snowboarding franchise into a Road Rash clone.

title: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones
review: Its a somewhat enjoyable romp though...its just not a very clean Star Wars title.

title: The Ripping Friends
review: This is a fairly average title with no fresh direction and without a real challenge it won’t keep many Gameboy fanatics busy for long.

title: Steel Battalion: Heavy Armor
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Vehicle | Mech | Mech | Combat
review: If youre a Kinect skeptic Steel Battalion: Heavy Armor will not change your mind. At all. Motion controls may work better or worse depending on the room but theyll never be accurate enough to let you survive an ambush.

title: Godzilla
review: The game is littered with fan service and was clearly made by people who love the property. In a way that’s what makes it so frustrating.

title: Bubble Bobble Revolution
review: The new game is frustrating repetitive and not as memorable as the first.

title: Pure Futbol
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Soccer | Sim | Arcade | Arcade
review: Not an entirely awful virtual re-creation of the beautiful game. [Issue#61 p.95]

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Like a Quidditch player falling from a broomstick mid-match this installment loses all forward momentum and goes plummeting toward a faceplant at top speed.

title: Far Cry Vengeance
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: We expect something special from Far Cry and frankly Vengeance just isnt up to scratch. Like a Z-list celebrity leave this one in the jungle.

title: Touhou Kobuto V: Burst Battle
review: Touhou Kobuto V: Burst Battle has decent Arcade and Score Attack modes and the idea of playing the same plot with different characters is worthy of praise but the fights quickly become repetitive and dull its audiovisual component is a throwback to fifteen years ago and overall the game just feels uninspired.

title: Randall
review: Whether it was the shoddy writing non-existent character development the floaty platforming physics or the combat mechanics that are often at odds with themselves Randall is the kind of game that is no more than the sum of its parts. Unfortunately that sum does not add up to a memorable experience.

title: Tenchu: Dark Secret
review: The latest entry in the once respectable ninja series is downright awful what with its lack of blood horrendous top down perspective and abominable story.

title: Napoleon Dynamite: The Game
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Puzzle | General | General | Puzzle | Party / Minigame | General
review: As a game its a little bit hard to recommend this especially considering that its basically just an assemblage of Flash-style games the kind you could play for free on a movie promo site.

title: Torino 2006 - The Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
genres: Sports | Olympic Sports | Olympic Sports | Individual | Athletics
review: The bottom line is that these events while fairly dreary in reality simply have no place in a game. For all its production values and official licence ultimately youd have a more interactive experience playing with a yoyo while watching the Winter Olympics on the telly.

title: Pocket Pool
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: Ignoring all else in favor of the pool games themselves Pocket Pool is a fun pick-up-and-play pool title with more features and better controls than youd expect accessible to both pool fans and casual gamers alike.

title: Speed Zone
review: Speed Zone is not a terrible game as much as it is one that seems to try too hard to impress.

title: TMNT
review: Coupled with the terrible combat the game is only 2 hours long.

title: Aqua Teen Hunger Force Zombie Ninja Pro-Am
review: Its a surprisingly silent boring affair and youre probably better off just watching the ATHF clips with your pal or one of the four full episodes included on the disc (one of which has never been aired and is awesome).

title: Shifters
review: The control and camera bugs made it somewhat frustrating to keep trying to progress the enemy AI made it dull and too easy to battle the side quests were mostly silly and I didn’t want to do them.

title: Legend of the Dragon
review: Just as the Legend of the Dragon TV series comes off as a faint echo of Dragon Ball Z The Game Factorys Wii adaptation serves as a reminder that it takes more than two battlers and an arena to make a memorable fighting game. [Aug 2007 p.84]

title: Quantum Theory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: In the end though Quantum Theory bears the terrible imprimatur of the also-ran. While its a noble effort on Tecmo-Koeis part (this is after all their first foray into this genre) it just doesnt have that oomph that a killer action game hits you in the sensory cortex with.

title: Duke Nukem: Land of the Babes
review: Fans of the genre can consider Land of the Babes a light snack between hearty meals.

title: Fight Club
review: If I was David Fincher right now I would be looking for the man or woman assigned to approve this project and making sure they never had a job again.

title: Agony
review: A depiction of hell that hasnt really been fully realised before Agony is marred by frustrating stealth sections and some poorly explained mechanics. The horrifying imagery is generally effective and the overall presentation manages to survive some glaring technical issues but this is very much an acquired taste in every sense of the word.

title: Crash Boom Bang!
review: Despite showing enormous potential Crash Boom Bang! is hampered by dodgy controls and a testing user interface. Its disappointing because this could have been a great multiplayer game. [Christmas 2006 p.80]

title: Gauntlet: Dark Legacy
review: As long as you don’t expect the fast pace and energy (not to mention multiplayer action) of it’s arcade and console counterparts you should have fun with this game.

title: Hour of Victory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Not that the game does anything bad it is as unoriginal as you can get in this land of competition.

title: Blackwater
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Enemy paths are obvious and at times theyll forget to shoot at you. Meanwhile youll die behind cover much too often requiring you to restart the whole level...If you can forgive these flaws Blackwater is old-school arcade fun and a solid step in making a hardcore Kinect game.

title: NFL Blitz 20-02
review: A landmark title with gameplay better than ever before and great play mechanics that defy portable gaming.

title: Left Alive
review: Left Alive has many good ideas. Some of them are well-executed and many others are not. It’s a shame that many of these issues are on the gameplay side but if you really like the concept you can manage to enjoy it.

title: Defender
review: A distinct lack of pace (something that made the original so absorbing) also makes the action far less exciting than it should be.

title: Rocky and Bullwinkle
review: The moose and the squirrel join a handful of friends to push buttons in the right order. [Issue#33 p.117]

title: Underworld Ascendant
review: Despite all the freedom for the player Underworld Ascendant is a bug-spectacle that in spite of its great looks is more boring than thrilling.

title: Wonder World Amusement Park
review: Okay if you can get it cheap but there are far too many better party titles out there.

title: Ready 2 Rumble Revolution
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Boxing | Boxing | Combat | Boxing / Martial Arts
review: With poor controls a mediocre graphics package sans the great characters and music that was bland all these make for a somewhat boring and average boxing experience.

title: Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing
review: Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing has a slew of faults that inevitably bring the title down but that’s not to say that you won’t have a good time in the ring.

title: Crystal Rift
review: A fitting tribute to classic dungeon crawlers though low difficulty a lack of a level editor and a boring esthetic keep it from becoming a classic in and of itself.

title: Traitors Gate 2
review: A silly story that the developers don’t try to develop generally easy puzzles that are boring to solve a bad interface that tests your patience more than your intelligence and so-so graphics that don’t make the game fun to look at.

title: Frogger 2
review: This game has no excuse. Its very expensive for what it has to offer and if I were to polish my Flash and ActionScript knowledge I could have created it myself!

title: Escape from Bug Island
review: We applaud the return to nature but outside of a few icky moments there really is nothing to recommend Necro-Nesia. Go throw a spider at someone; its a whole lot more fun. [JPN Import; Mar 2007 p.52]

title: Tamagotchi Party On!
review: Its got plenty of cute Tamagotchis but its short on depth and is seriously lacking in the fun department.

title: 3D Classics: Urban Champion
review: The release of Urban Champion as a 3D Classic makes us wonder if Nintendo has gone stark raving mad.

title: Lucha Fury
review: Lucha Fury is a beat-em-up with a polished artistic direction colorful visuals and poor gameplay.

title: Fluster Cluck
review: Consider it only if youve got a captive audience no internet connection and some time to kill with friends — and above all else dont expect too much.

title: Combat Medic: Special Operations
review: Horrid control combined with a poor interface leaves Combat Medic gasping for air on the battlefield.

title: Past Cure
review: Though there are some definite strengths throughout Past Cure like the textural environments the melodies and the overall world duality it simply fails to really take advantage of the hype gained from its badass trailers.

title: Dead Space Ignition
genres: Puzzle | Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | Puzzle | Shooter | Third-Person | Action | General | Sci-Fi
review: Dead Space: Ignition isnt a great game or even a good one.

title: Pimp My Ride
review: No amount of Xzibit influence or ride pimpage can save Pimp My Ride from its god-awful minigames and lousy driving mechanics.

title: The History Channel: Battle for the Pacific
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: There are a ton of fine shooters hitting shelves this year that are good enough to go down in history. It would be a shame to waste your money paying full price for this heap which instead takes history down with it.

title: Sniper: Art of Victory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Historic | Historic
review: Sniper: Art of Victory is a budget title and as such can be excused for some superficial failings. Unfortunately some of its failings are more than superficial take much of the fun out of the game.

title: Torino 2006 - the Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
review: As for Torino 2006 I would look in the bargain bin for International Winter Sports 2002 instead.

title: Darkstar: The Interactive Movie
genres: Action | Adventure | Interactive Movie | General | Interactive Movie
review: Long-dead genre strikes back with cool screenplay and compelling story. Difficulty is pretty hard and controls deserve much improvement. [Issue#200]

title: Shaq Fu: A Legend Reborn
review: Shaq-Fu: A Legend Reborn is a fun title for as long as it lasts and a forgettable one once it ends.

title: The Sum of All Fears
review: It feels like youre not fully in control. [Dec 2002 p.236]

title: Kung Fu Rider
review: Kung Fu Rider is definitely not as funny as it thinks it is and not really much fun either.

title: NBA Live 14
genres: Arcade | Sports | Traditional | Team | Basketball | Arcade
review: For my interest in something to be increased it has to be entertaining. This is where NBA Live 14 ultimately falls short for me.

title: Coffin Dodgers
review: There were elements that I enjoyed about Coffin Dodgers and the fast-paced action and ragdoll physics led to some crazy races and funny fails. I enjoyed the story mode especially with its amusing ending. Plus the final showdown race is brilliant. But the game lacks depth and doesn’t really have that draw that made me want to keep playing especially with the omission of online features.

title: X-Men: Destiny
review: With a few more months development this might have come good. But in this state not even Professor Xavier could convince us to play it again.

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: The game follows a simple beat em up formula that will keep you entertained for awhile but it lacks so much of the depth and creativity that we expect from the comics and movies.

title: Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Damnation is an unfinished game a concept with good ideas and a real sense of scale but terrible implementation in almost every way.

title: The Shield: The Game
review: I really wanted to like The Shield. Unless you’re a Shield enthusiast like me you’ll be safe passing on this one.

title: Orion: Dino Horde
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: While Orion: Dino Horde has potential it will certainly fall short of even modest expectations. If it werent for there already being quite the track record of bad Jurassic games Id suggest that fighting dinosaurs has never been so dull. A shame since its evident that the developers put a lot of time into it... its just too bad they didnt focus on making it fun.

title: Dream Chronicles
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | Hidden Object | General | Puzzle | General
review: Leave your superhero cape at home; Dream Chronicles instead begs for a mouse and keyboard--but this is a 360 game and theres no such pairing in sight. [Jan 2011 p.76]

title: Power Gig: Rise of the SixString
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Rhythm | Music Maker | Music Maker | Music
review: Everything about playing Power Gig: Rise of the SixString is either disappointing or irksome in some way.

title: Air Conflicts: Aces of World War II
review: A number of notable frustrations keep this moderately enjoyable flight-combat sim from soaring.

title: MTV's Celebrity Deathmatch
review: Add some simple moves a little combo and repeat...constantly. The special death move was also a failed attempt in my book.

title: Disney Sports Skateboarding
review: The controls are buggy the graphics are choppy the sound is average and the voices will make you crawl up a wall in fear of your life.

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Arcade Attack
review: A mere shadow of what a scrolling beatem up should be. The TMNT logo isnt enough to justify such a poor game who will particularly let down the ones who really loved the comics and the animated series dedicated to the four Ninja Turtles.

title: Hollow
review: A horror game with good ideas that comes up short in many aspects: while its history is addictive and progressively improves its short duration brings us back to reality and while its setting and sound put us in a tense mood with some jump scares mixed in its technical side takes us out of that mood with a significant range of defects to be cleaned up.

title: Legends of Pegasus
review: Please Calypso and Nova Core: Rescue what can be saved.

title: Power Gig: Rise of the SixString
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Rhythm | Music Maker | Music Maker | Music
review: The guitar is underutilized the music selection (despite a few gems) is merely average and the graphics are very last-gen.

title: Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Not quite so bad its good but not so bad its awful either. Its worth a rent but just for laughs. [Aug 2009 p.82]

title: Alekhine's Gun
review: When the various elements come together which does happen in certain sections and when fate allows the game has the potential to be a clever informative and historically accurate stealth game set among one of the most intriguing and fascinating in recent history but too often this potential is over shadowed by clunky controls questionable AI and dated graphics that make the game look like it is a port from a previous console generation.

title: Jeremy McGrath Supercross World
review: The same mediocre game on the Cube as it was on the PS2.

title: Torrente
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Really disappointing [gameplay] poor controls poorly designed missions poor execution.

title: Umbrella Corps
review: Every level is very small and no matter where you decide to hole up it will be easy for enemies to flank you. It’s not bad by itself but such design makes cover system – which was to become one of Umbrella Corps’ trump cards – redundant. So it comes as no surprise that combat quickly devolves into chasing after one another with one-hit-kill ax in hand. Of course it’s hard to talk about tactics or teamplay in this lumberjack’s paradise. [Issue#211 p.56]

title: Risen 3: Titan Lords
review: While this won’t put off those who managed to overlook the shortcomings of the previous two games those looking to sign up for the first time on this voyage may want to seriously consider if the pirate life is for them.

title: Double D Dodgeball
genres: Action | Sports | General | General | Team | Other
review: The individual layers of variation dont run terribly deep and offline exhibitions only cast a harsh light on amateurish A.I. flaws but Double D Dodgeballs offbeat mix of arcade action and online sporting teamwork still packs enough fast-paced intensity and simple strategy to be worth inviting to recess. [Sept 2008 p.77]

title: Arc of Alchemist
review: Arc of Alchemist had potential but ultimately fails to deliver a compelling experience. If you like chibi characters lots of dialogue grinding and mindless battle systems you might enjoy Arc of Alchemist. Otherwise this is a game you can easily skip.

title: Fight Club
review: The worst-case scenario is that you pick a fight with the game store clerk who let you buy this title and get your face punched in. Then youll be stuck with both a black eye and a crummy game.

title: Eternity: The Last Unicorn
review: Eternity: The Last Unicorn is not a great game. It’s a game that takes from Norse mythology but doesn’t really go deep enough to make you feel like you’re on a viking adventure. You can’t skip the cut scenes the camera is the hardest boss in the game and it just doesn’t live up to the games it emulates. I like you Eternity I just wanted better.

title: Tokyo Tattoo Girls
review: Tokyo Tattoo Girls is an extremely niche strategy RPG that doesnt build off of what is most interesting about the games systems and instead chooses to rely on cute anime girls for appeal which might work for some.

title: One Piece: Grand Cruise
review: All in all fun and able to show the historical characters of the brand from a different point of view ONE PIECE: Grand Cruise would have won hands down our sympathy (and sufficiency) if it had been proposed not as a game but as a VR experience maybe free or otherwise at a price consistent with the very few contents offered by the package.

title: Infernal: Hell's Vengeance
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: The story is original but poorly told. The action is fast-paced but frustrating. Everything seems like a winner on paper but when you finally get your hands on the controller things just fall apart.

title: Tsunami 2265
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The gameplay of Tsunami 2265 is best-suited for younger or for casual gamers.

title: Jackass the Game
review: While the game seems to be somewhat technically proficient and the single player campaign is moderately extensive the repetitive nature of the gameplay and the mind-numbing tasks tend to drag on.

title: Bad Boys: Miami Takedown
review: Theres two cops Mike and Marcus. Wheres the two player simultaneous co-op mode?

title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
review: Boring and sub-par gameplay combined with bland visuals and sounds creates a gaming experience that should be missed. More time was needed fine tuning things such as game mechanics visuals and audio.

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: With all of the gameplay and control issues the game simply isn’t any fun.

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: It would be nice to play as each character in a Gauntlet-style format but the lack of distinctive abilities for each of the four characters puts the kibosh on that dream. One could surmise that this game was doomed from the start.

title: Dead Space Ignition
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | Shooter | Puzzle | Puzzle | Third-Person | Action | Sci-Fi
review: Even for hardcore Dead Space fans (which we are) skipping Ignition will mean missing nothing of import to the Dead Space canon.

title: 7 Days to Die
developer: Iron Galaxy Studios | The Fun Pimps
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Shooter | Survival | Sandbox | First-Person | Arcade
review: With a user interface barely optimized for controllers and a release three years after its initial alpha it feels that consoles are a mere afterthought of the original vision.

title: Jeremy McGrath Supercross World
review: If players approach Supercross World as an arcade racer that plays by the indoor and outdoor rules of motocross though then it has plenty to offer...Dead-average brain-dead motocross fun at its most basic level.

title: George of the Jungle and the Search for the Secret
review: Its harmless but hardly worth bothering with. [May 2008 p.74]

title: The Golden Compass
review: Poor graphics and simple game-play detract from what could have been a great film-game conversion.

title: Enemy Front
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Historic | Historic
review: While the modest selection of maps are sufficiently large and multileveled the uninspired deathmatch and conquest modes offer nothing that you cant find in other shooters.

title: Showtime Championship Boxing
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Boxing | Boxing | Combat | Boxing / Martial Arts
review: Its sad really if under a different developer – it could have made for a viable opponent to the big boxing titles like but instead DSI games decided to make it a cheap gimmicky imitation of that which came before.

title: Street Jam Basketball
review: Its obvious that some care and talent went into the making of this game. Unfortunately it just didnt dribble down to the most important part - the gameplay.

title: Bad Boys: Miami Takedown
review: Suffers from mediocrity. It is a solid game but there is nothing outstanding about it that would draw players to it or make the title worth acquiring. The game implements the two signature characters poorly which makes for annoying gameplay and there is no multiplayer portion whatsoever.

title: NCIS
review: Its difficult to not view the NCIS game as a blatant cash grab. It may be available at the lower price point of $40 ($30 for PC) but the four cases only take about four hours to complete and there is zero replay value.

title: Drug Wars (2009)
review: Imagine if you will a weapon that not only blows a guy to smithereens and covers the screen with more blood than a MASH unit but also causes him to burst into flames and even projectile vomit all over himself for several painful seconds before he blows up. And if that isnt disgusting enough for you imagine grabbing one of his severed legs and whacking another dude over the head with it until he in turn spews even more blood and vomit and flames. Ew.

title: The History Channel: Battle for the Pacific
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: The History Channel implementation level setup and graphic selections are A+ choices; it’s the execution that tanks the experience.

title: Girl Fight
review: The only way I could possibly recommend this game to anyone is if you have a blossoming interest in both breasts and fighting games and are trapped on some sort of desert island with a PS3 that only has Girl Fight on it. Everyone else is going to want to look elsewhere.

title: Valhalla Knights: Eldar Saga
review: I went into Valhalla Knights with high hopes including the optimism for a clean and smart online co-op multiplayer with a deep and engrossing storyline. Unfortunately I found a very broken and incomplete gaming experience.

title: Super Seducer: How to Talk to Girls
review: Super Seducer can only be seen as a relic of a thankfully bygone era and may only crack a smile with its cult vibe. The whole PUA idea has already been criticized and no-one is expected to take it seriously. Other than that its a sort of visual novel with linear progression that glorifies the quantification of flirting and the conditioning of people to Pavlovian techniques.

title: Fugitive Hunter: War on Terror
review: This game is not very realistic and tries to combine arcade elements with a solid FPS backdrop and what happens is that this game looks contrived and stilted...This is a game to avoid.

title: Star Raiders
genres: Action | Simulation | General | Sci-Fi | Space | Small Spaceship | Small Spaceship | Combat
review: Theres no denying it. Star Raiders is bad. Its repetitive embarrassing rushed and tedious.

title: King of Clubs
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Golf | Arcade | Arcade
review: King of Clubs feels like yet another me too title in a sea of the same.

title: Langrisser Re:Incarnation -TENSEI-
review: But again I found the soul of Langrisser to be well and truly in the right place and while I don’t believe it is a classic game I also don’t believe for a moment that it deserves the commentary it has been getting to date.

title: ShellShock 2: Blood Trails
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Third-Person | Historic | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Frustrating and joyless. [Apr 2009 p.74]

title: Fireburst
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | Rally / Offroad | Rally / Offroad | Automobile
review: Theres only one number that reflects this perfectly average experience.

title: Rambo: The Video Game
review: It’s a B-movie game in every sense but approach it with sufficiently lowered expectations and you may just be pleasantly surprised.

title: Jekyll & Hyde (2001)
review: This game is fun until you try to move. Rent the movie folks. It’s scarier and shorter.

title: The Expendables 2 Videogame
genres: Action | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Modern | Top-Down
review: Its never anything special. Theres lots of action but its not exciting. Theres an upgrade system but its uninteresting. Theres a lot of content but its just the same stuff again and again.

title: David Beckham Soccer
review: This is by far one of the most disappointing and seemingly unfinished games that I have ever played in my entire life.

title: Shadow Harvest: Phantom Ops
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Tactical | Modern | Modern
review: Its not a terrible game but it is a deeply average one.

title: Takedown: Red Sabre
genres: Action | Shooter | General | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Tactical
review: Rarely exciting mostly disappointing. An unfinished tactical shooter let down by technical issues and terrible AI.

title: Destroy All Humans! Path of the Furon
review: While the game packs some potential the constant barrage of technical glitches renders it all but unplayable and leave it feeling like an unfinished work that was rushed to the shelves a month or two too soon.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: It’s boilerplate first-person shooter mechanics paired with dated visuals and cool ideas that never develop into cool experiences.

title: Past Cure
review: Quotation forthcoming.

title: March of the Penguins
review: This game is not fun. The game is too hard to be a childrens game and too boring to be a game to recommend to anyone; and thats when its working and not screwing the player over with bad controls.

title: Agony
review: Agony has good ideas but the developers have underrated the complexity of the survival horror genre and delivered a frustrating experience. Add its poor performance and bugs and you get a forgettable game.

title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon - Stealth Force Edition
review: I am a diehard Transformers fan ever since the original G1 series and I cant believe such a staple of the series is missing. With the lack of features average graphics acceptable sound and a completion time of less than 7 hours Id say Transformers: Dark of the Moon - Stealth Force Edition is a budget title at best but nothing an avid gamer or hardcore fan would take seriously especially with the 50$ price tag.

title: You Are Empty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Arcade
review: Any fan of the genre has already been here and done this before — probably 2-3 years ago. While the visual and aural facets of YAE are generally solid its gameplay is not all that entertaining and there are plenty of other titles in the genre that can offer a more entertaining and diversified gaming experience.

title: Astro Boy: The Video Game
review: A bad camera and bad controls however quickly shoot down this game with little to no hope of it getting better as you progress. For fans of the movie and the character it would be best to hunt down the GBA game to get their fix. If you dont have a system that can play that however your best bet would be to hold off on this and hope that someone will come along and do justice to this revered character.

title: Bomberman: Act Zero
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Action | General | Puzzle | Action
review: Had it been released as a slimmed-down Xbox Live Arcade title Bomberman Act: Zero would be a surefire hit right up there with Zuma in terms of addictive stage-based gameplay. But instead Bomberman Act: Zero is a $49.99 standalone title that you simply shouldn’t buy.

title: Fantasy Hero: Unsigned Legacy
review: As with most JPRGs a lot of progression options are present related to special powers and weapon upgrades. Since they don’t make the combat any easier to digest it doesn’t feel relevant to get too detailed about them. Not mentioning that you manually have to click through endless English dialogue while listening to Japanese voice acting doesn’t really change the fact that Fantasy Hero ~Unsigned Legacy~ is a title that can and should be ignored.

title: The Shield: The Game
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: If anything The Shield: The Game is true to the spirit of its source material. Much of the game may be poorly designed cruelly difficult and obnoxiously unfair but none of these flaws are necessarily show-stopping.

title: Girl Fight
review: Girl Fight is a game that lives up to its name both in relevancy and simply being generic. Anyone thinking of jumping in knows what to expect but if you want scantily clad fighters there are much better options.

title: McFarlane's Evil Prophecy
review: Dull depressing and monotonous. Although the combat system is reasonably interesting the game doesnt come close to making the most of it.

title: Chicago Enforcer
review: The game is fun to play for a bit but the flaws of the gameplay and the repetition creep up faster than Capones top enforcer in a dark alley delivering the most lethal blow to the games bottom line.

title: Shrek: Super Party
review: Are we going to be forever destined to inferior products based on popular characters wading through a series of hackneyed mini games?

title: AMY
review: After a complicated first launch Amy is reborn again to give some scares to this needed generation. Its a shame that all the good ideas the game has in its basics are not applied to the final version plagued with multiple bugs of AI control and visuals.

title: Kick-Ass
review: Shallow and repetitive gameplay dull visuals and overused poor-quality film assets put this game in the failed-superhero category.

title: Superman Returns
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Beat-'Em-Up | Beat-'Em-Up | Open-World | 2D
review: While it’s not the worst Superman game ever made it’s still not anything any sane person would want to play. If you need a Superman fix go rent the DVD instead.

title: The Incredible Hulk
review: Hulk’s orgy of destruction is entertaining at the beginning but unfortunately it’s the only motivating thing in the game. Both the missions and the story are weak.

title: Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing
review: With precious little true depth and a distinct lack of quality boxers to topple Tyson from his in-game mantle youll just not want to put in the hours at the gym. [PSM2]

title: Farming Simulator
review: Only hipsters and farming fetishists need apply. [Nov 2013 p.91]

title: X Rebirth
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Space | Large Spaceship | Large Spaceship | Civilian
review: No matter what happens with stability and bug-fixing patches its poor controls awful interface and dull pacing ensure that X Rebirth will remain unpleasant for all but the most forgiving die-hard space jockeys.

title: Dawn of Fear
review: Dawn of Fear is not what you would typically consider a good video game and it most definitely does not perform like one. However when it works there hasn’t been anything else quite like it for the best part of two decades. Dawn of Fear is the best and worst tribute to Resident Evil at the same time and we cant think anything more intriguing than that.

title: Van Helsing
review: Responsive play control and detailed graphics will make you want to venture deep into the story but difficult battles against incidental enemies may keep you from your goal. [Aug 2004 p.123]

title: Yu Yu Hakusho: Spirit Detective
review: A compass points to your current objective but its still easy to get lost in the games complex levels. [Mar 2004 p.121]

title: Demonworld: Dark Armies
review: Underneath its underwhelming exterior lurks an enjoyable well-balanced game that grows on you if you can just stomach the painful delivery. [May 2002 p.74]

title: Dragon Booster
review: Despite a cool concept the unusable controls and other flaws prevent Dragon Booster from making the cut.

title: Call of Duty: Black Ops Declassified
genres: Shooter | Modern | Action | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Arcade
review: It feels unfinished and rushed through development. We really think it couldve been polished to make it a better game but unless an important patch comes out its really hard to recommend taking into account all the constant crashes when playing online and the extremely short single player modes.

title: Mistmare
review: Mistmare has some truly wondrous landscapes and jaw-dropping monsters and such thanks in no small part to the LithTech engine but it just came out of the oven too early. [Nov 2003 p.118]

title: Mortal Kombat Advance
review: Has the feel of a hasty port which is par for the course with Mortal Kombat games these days. But fun for a short while. [Summer 2003 p.30]

title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Crossfire
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Vehicle | Mech | Mech | Combat
review: Sure its oddly satisfying to lumber around trading shots and crossing plasma swords with other stylized death machines but the slow stiff gameplay overshadows the cool stuff. [Jan. 2007 p.84]

title: Megamind: Ultimate Showdown
review: Buy this game only if youre under 12 and a fan of the movie.

title: Target: Terror
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Light Gun | Light Gun
review: With only ten levels and no multiple pathways the game is fairly short on content. You will most likely only play this game for three to five hours making the forty-dollar price tag seem way too steep to consider it for a purchase. Still the game can be a lot of fun.

title: Iron Man
review: Even fans of the comic won’t have fun with this piece. At the beginning the permanent explosions are quite entertaining but soon they get as boring as the monotony of a firing machine gun. No thanks!

title: Bruce Lee: Quest of the Dragon
review: The controls are so weak that I am having a tough time deciding which is more aggravating: controlling Bruce Lee or non-stop clipping. Either way youll be disgruntled by this games lack of an intuitive control system.

title: Rekoil
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: The problems of Rekoil are many starting with the unbalanced weapon system to the extremely annoying and frequent visual bugs. The respawn system has been miscalculated. Bad sound animations and poor 3D models come together to provide a badly balanced game.

title: Zombeer
review: As it is Zombeer stands as a decent zombie based FPS with a dash of hit or miss humor.

title: Women's Volleyball Championship
review: If you really want to play a volleyball video game stick with the older titles that focus on beach volleyball or pray that someone can come up with a better take on the indoor version of the sport.

title: MTV's Celebrity Deathmatch
review: Since the game does provide some laughs and is fun when a friend is over $20 isnt too bad for the game.

title: Weeping Doll
review: Weeping Doll isn’t much of a game and at just an hour long with no hidden depth to necessitate a second playthrough it’s overpriced at ten dollars. That said as a first-generation console VR proof-of-concept it succeeds more than it fails.

title: Land of the Dead: Road to Fiddler's Green
review: The multiplayer can be fun but only because it means you wont have to endure the game alone.

title: Escape Dead Island
genres: Action Adventure | Adventure | 3D | Survival | Third-Person | Modern
review: Apart from that absolutely baffling meat grinder at the end Id still recommend Escape to fans of the mid-list. 98% of it was an enjoyable spiral into insanity and the project could certainly stand on its own even without being attached to the Dead Island franchise -- just be ready to slog through that final bit to see how it all wraps up.

title: Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric
review: It’s admirable that Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric tries so many new things but every path it follows is a dead end.

title: Gene Rain
review: Gene Rain is a disappointment. It is ultimately good looking enough but shallow with poor gameplay and frankly laughable dialogue. The acting is poor the guns lack heft and the cover mechanic is broken so much that you really don’t want to get me started.

title: Giana Sisters: Dream Runners
review: The clunky controls combined with a ghost town of players to actually play this game online with really works against this title.

title: Best of Tests DS
review: A game that you should certainly pass by. It has few if any redeeming qualities and Im hard-pressed to imagine the sort of person who could actually have fun with this title.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: It’s a half-baked attempt at a game that can be fun in the occasional spooky part but ends up under-delivering in every way.

title: New World Order
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Tactical | Modern | Arcade
review: If only the developers had spent more time polishing the single player mode to have a real story with in-game cutscenes and such. If only the single player had a mid-mission save system or at the very least if it didnt take so long to reload the level every time you died.

title: The Expendables 2 Videogame
genres: Action | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Modern | Top-Down
review: Like the movie The Expendables 2 video game is shallow and focused on but one thing : brutal combats with millions of bullets flying. The only problem is that as it may be fun to watch in a 1 hour and a half movie its far from being fun to play for 3 and half hours even cooperatively especially with such low production values.

title: Jenga World Tour
review: Why strain your eyes on a smaller version of the stack when you can just clear some space off the kitchen table and play the real thing?

title: Fighters Uncaged
review: This unique fighting game feels rushed in every single way. Fighters Uncaged responds very badly to your moves and thats simply something you cant afford when your life is at stake.

title: Dave Mirra BMX Challenge
review: Mr Mirra may have been around for a long time but it seems that it is possible for an old rider to need to learn some new tricks because a lack of originality and options as well as some below par design overshadow the better qualities of Dave Mirra BMX Challenge.

title: Coliseum
review: Doesn’t feel interactive enough to be deeply involving. Much faster higher level seasons or far more options are needed to make the Coliseum exciting.

title: Kabuki Warriors
review: A strangely bland fighting game. [Jan 2002]

title: Pool Party
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: Poor presentation poor playability AI-fueled opponent… If you are fan of pool games there are simply better options available.

title: Magus
review: Give me a quality plot or an interesting setting or something to impress me enough to work through its weaker elements. Magus doesnt offer any stand out feature which makes it difficult to get too excited over.

title: Ghostbusters
review: Ghostbusters offers a top-down co-op shooter with light RPG elements that fails to capitalize on the magic and humor of the supernatural franchise.

title: The Simpsons Wrestling
review: A must-have for any fan of the show. It is amusing and entertaining.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5
review: Tony Hawk Pro Skater 5 fails to recapture the magic of the first four games.

title: Toy Shop
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: While every series needs its foundation Toy Shop feels like the blueprint of something better.

title: The Asskickers
review: Maybe if this budget title were offered for 5 dollars more gamers might be interested in putting on their asskicking shoes. For now though I cant offer much of a recommendation.
